In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. O Lord, complete this with Your grace and generosity.

After praising God, who opened the lights of wisdom in the gardens of flourishing minds, clarified the secrets of words in the gardens of observant thoughts, preserved the system of eloquence in every time and era, and confined the types of rhetoric into the two categories of poetry and prose. And He sent His Prophet and chosen one, Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, with the eloquence of tongue and expression, and wisdom of clear proof, distinguished by beautiful delivery and clarification. May He purify his family and support his companions, the possessors of bright faces and eloquent tongues.

I had previously compiled a book containing the delicate poems of the moderns regarding erotic poetry, containing the best of what their thoughts allowed in terms of spinning and flirtation. I named it 'Al-Nuzha Al-Sa'diyya fi Al-Ash'ar Al-Arabiyya' (The Sa'di Excursion in Arabic Poems), embroidered with the name of he who has settled in the highest peak of glory, and whose steed of virtue and generosity outpaced the preceding steeds. The nights shine with his lights, and fates bow before his awesomeness. He has given noble deeds their highest place... He is the Great Companion, the Served Master, the wielder of the sword and the pen, the holder of the reins of nations, the refuge of the sons of Adam, the Asaf of the time, the master of the Divan of Kingdoms in the East and West, the Sultan of Ministers far and near, Sa'd (Joy) of the Truth, the World, and Religion, the support of Kings and Sultans, the refuge of scholars in the worlds... [Dedication continues praising the patron Sa'd al-Din].

The group approached to memorize, study, research, and read it, so they requested that I compile a collection containing the subtleties of the poetry of the ancients, and the rare verses of the Pre-Islamic and Mukhadram poets, in various arts. I saw that fulfilling what they proposed was most appropriate. So I proceeded to select what is precious in meaning, brilliant in wording and content, chosen in casting, straight in construction, beautiful in opening, and good in closing. It serves as material for the writer and the poet, guaranteeing to sharpen the mind and clear the thoughts. I selected from the three Hamasahs available to me: The Hamasah of Abu Tammam Habib bin Aws Al-Tai, the Hamasah of Abu Hilal Al-Hasan bin Abdullah bin Sahl, and the Hamasah of Sheikh Ahmad bin Faris, may God have mercy on them. I added to them delicate poems of the moderns and rare verses of the later poets at the end of each chapter, following the path of brevity without prolixity. I also added other chapters on types of poetry needed in correspondence, messages, and dialogues that are not in these Hamasahs. Thus, this selection came with gentle purposes, pure sources and resources, free from strange words, cleared of wild expressions, combining Bedouin strength with the delicacy of civilization, like a wild tree in hardness and a garden tree in freshness.

I presented it to his noble library... and named it 'Al-Tadhkirah Al-Sa'diyya fi Al-Ash'ar Al-Arabiyya' (The Sa'di Memorandum on Arabic Poems)... I arranged it into fourteen chapters:
1. On Enthusiasm and Pride (Hamasah).
2. On Literature, Wisdom, and Proverbs.
3. On Erotic Poetry (Nasib).
4. On Praise, Asking, Soliciting Sympathy, and Demanding.
5. On Elegies.
6. On Satire.
7. On Fraternal Matters (Ikhwaniyyat).
8. On Congratulations.
9. On Apologies.
10. On Descriptions.
11. On Admonition and Complaint of Time's Events and Patience.
12. On Witticisms (Mulah).
13. On Miscellaneous Things.
14. On Supplication.

The Fourteenth Chapter: On Supplication.

Chapter One: Enthusiasm and Pride (Hamasah)

Some of the Banu Qais bin Tha'labah said (and it is said to be by Bashama bin Hazn Al-Nahshali):
We greet you, O Salma, so greet us back / And if you offer drink to the noble people, offer it to us.
And if you call upon the chiefs of the noble people / For a calamity or a noble deed one day, call upon us.
We, the Banu Nahshal, do not claim a father / Other than him, nor does he sell us for other sons.
If a goal is raced for one day for a noble deed / You will find the winners among us and the second-place runners.
The whiteness of our partings (hair), our cooking pots boil / We heal with our wealth the scars of our hands.
We hold our lives cheap on the day of fear / But if we were sold during peace, we would be expensive.
We are of a people whose ancestors were annihilated / By the call of the warriors: 'Where are the defenders?'
If there was one of us among a thousand, and they called out / 'Who is a knight?' they would think it meant him.
When the warriors step aside lest they be reached / By the edge of the swords, we connect them with our hands.
You do not see them, even if their calamity is great / Weeping with those who weep over the dead.
We ride the hateful (war) at times, and it is relieved / From us by honor and swords that favor us.

Al-Samaw'al bin Adiya the Jew said (and it is said to be by Abdul Malik bin Abdul Rahim Al-Harithi):
If a man’s honor is not sullied by baseness / Then every cloak he wears is beautiful.
And if he does not carry himself through oppression / Then there is no way to good praise.
She criticizes us that our numbers are few / So I said to her: Indeed, the noble ones are few.
Those whose remnants are like us have not diminished / Youths who aspire to heights and elders.
It does not harm us that we are few, while our neighbor / Is mighty, and the neighbor of the majority is humiliated.
We have a mountain where those we protect settle / Impregnable, it turns back the eye tired and dull.
Its root is anchored under the soil and its clouds / Reach the stars; a branch unreachable and long.
We are a people who do not see killing as a disgrace / While (the tribes of) Amir and Salul see it as such.
The love of death brings our appointed times closer to us / While their hatred of it lengthens their times.
No master among us died a natural death in bed / Nor was a slain one of us left unavenged where he was killed.
Our souls flow upon the edge of swords / And they do not flow upon other than swords.
We are pure, so we did not become murky, and our essence remained pure / Females who carried us well and stallions.
We ascended to the best of backs (steeds/lineage), and we descended / In time to the best of bellies.
We are like the rain cloud; there is no bluntness in our lineage / Nor is a miser counted among us.
We deny the words of people if we wish / But they do not deny the words when we speak.
If a master among us passes, a master rises / One who speaks what the noble say and does it.
No fire of ours was ever extinguished against a night visitor / Nor did a guest ever blame us.
Our days (of battle) are famous among our enemy / They have known blazes and white markings (signs of fame).
Our swords in every east and west / Have notches from striking the armored ones.
Accustomed not to have their blades drawn / Then sheathed until a tribe is annihilated.
Ask, if you are ignorant, about us and about them / For the knowledgeable and the ignorant are not equal.
Indeed, the Banu al-Dayyan are the pole for their people / Their millstones turn around them and roam.

A man from Bal'anbar bin Tamim, named Qurayt bin Aneef, said:
If I were from Mazin, my camels would not have been deemed permissible / By the sons of the foundling from Dhuhul bin Shayban.
Then a rough group would have risen to my aid / At the moment of anger, even if the slow one softens.
A people who, when evil bares its molars to them / Fly to it in groups and individuals.
They do not ask their brother, when he calls them / In calamities, for proof of what he says.
But my people, even if they are numerous / Are not involved in evil, even if it is light.
They repay oppression—is oppression forgiveness?— / And the evil of the evildoers with kindness.
As if your Lord did not create anyone / Among all people to fear Him except them.
I wish I had, instead of them, a people who, when they ride / Launch a raid, as knights and riders.

Al-Fand Al-Zamani said concerning the War of Basus (His name was Shahl bin Shayban):
We forgave the Banu Dhuhul / And we said the people are brothers.
Perhaps the days might return / The people to how they used to be.
But when evil declared itself / And ended up naked (exposed).
And nothing remained but aggression / We treated them as they treated us.
We walked the walk of the lion / Morning comes and the lion is angry.
With a striking in which there is weakening / Subjugation and binding.
For some ignorance, in the face of ignorance / Is submission to humiliation.

And in evil there is salvation / When kindness does not save you.

Abu Al-Ghoul Al-Tahawi said:
May my soul and what my right hand owns be a ransom / For knights who proved my thoughts about them true.
Knights who do not tire of death / When the mill of the pushing war turns.
They do not repay kindness with evil / Nor do they repay roughness with softness.
Their bravery does not wear out, even if they / Are roasted by war time after time.
They protected the sanctuary of Al-Waqba with a striking / That unites the scattered parts of death.
So avoid the repelling of enemies from them / And treat madness with madness.
They do not graze the sides of ease / When they settle, nor is the land peaceful.

Ja'far bin Ulba Al-Harithi said:
When we raced to a strait, there opened for us / In our right hands, white swords polished by the polishers.
They (the enemy) had the chest of my sword on the day of Bat'ha Sahbal / And I had from it what the fingertips grasped.
We did not know whether we shied away from death / How much of life remains and if the term is long.
And he also said:
Nothing uncovers the distress except the son of a free woman / Who sees the floods of death and then visits them.
Our swords divide them in an evil division / So we have their coverings (scabbards/hilts) and they have their chests (blades).

Rabi'a bin Maqrum Al-Dabbi said:
I witnessed the horses on the day of their chase / At Salim, with structure and stout legs.
They called out 'Get down (to fight)', so I was the first to get down / For what reason should I ride it if I do not dismount (to fight)?
And a fierce opponent, angry at me, as if / The enmity of his chest boils in a cauldron.
I postponed him from me, then saw his intent / And I branded (stabbed) him above the eyes from above.

Bal'aa bin Qais Al-Kinani said:
And a knight immersed in the floods of death / When he swore to a hateful thing, he fulfilled it.
I covered him, while he was in fierce armor / With a sharp sword that hit the middle of the head and split it.
With a strike that was not a stealthy one from me / Nor did I hasten it out of cowardice or fear.

Sa'd bin Nashib Al-Mazini said:
I will wash shame away from myself with the sword, bringing / Upon myself the decree of God, whatever it brings.
I will forget my home and make its destruction / A barrier for my honor against remaining blame.
My inherited wealth becomes small in my eyes if my right hand / Bends to achieve what I was seeking.
If you destroy my house by treachery, then it is / The heritage of a noble man who does not care about consequences.
A man of determinations, who does not want, for what / He intends of decisive matters, a companion.
If he intends, the resolve of his intent is not deterred / And he does not come to what he does of affairs in fear.
O Rizam! Prepare for me a way forward / To death, plunging into the battalions.
When he intends, he casts his resolve between his eyes / And throws aside the thought of consequences.
He did not consult anyone in his affair but himself / And was not pleased with any companion but the hilt of the sword.

Abu Kabir Al-Hudhali said:
I traveled in the darkness with a reckless determination / Tough among the youths, not heavy/sluggish.
Of those whom women carried while they were tying / The knots of the belt, so he grew up without defect.
Cleared from every remnant of menstruation / And the corruption of a nursing woman and a suckling pregnant one.
She conceived him in a night of fear / Unwillingly, and the knot of her belt was not untied.
She brought him, wild of heart, lean-bellied / Awake when the night of the foolish sleeper sleeps.
If you look at the lines of his face / They flash like the lightning of the joyous cloud.
Difficult in battle, his side cannot be violated / Sharp of resolve like the sharp cutting sword.
He protects the companions when there is a hateful battle / And when they dismount, he is the shelter of the poor.

Ta'abbata Sharran (his name was Thabit bin Jabir) said:
If a man does not use stratagems when his luck is serious / He loses and suffers his affair while retreating.
But the man of prudence is the one whom / Calamity does not befall unless he sees the way out.
He is the master of time as long as he lives; around him / If one nostril is blocked, another nostril flows (he finds a way).
I say to Lihyan when their whistlers whistled / And my day was narrow, the stone enclosed / hindering.
They are two plans: either captivity and a favor (being spared) / Or blood, and killing is more fitting for the free man.
And another (plan) I turn my soul towards, and it is / A source of prudence if I do it, and a resource.
I spread my chest for it, so there slipped from the rock / A thick chest and a narrow waist.
He mixed with the soft earth, the rock did not scratch / Him a single scratch, and death stood looking in shame.
So I returned to Fahm, and I was not returning (expectedly) / And how many like it (perilous situations) I left while it whistled (empty).

He also said:
I am sending my praise and intending / With it the son of the noble uncle, Shams bin Malik.
Little complaining about the important matter that befalls him / Much love, scattered in directions and paths.

He remains in a desert and spends the evening in another / Alone, riding the backs of perils.
He outstrips the delegation of the wind from where it blows / With a dash from his continuous running.
If the slumber of sleep stitches his eyes, there remains / A guard for him from the heart of a vigilant, deadly one.
He makes his eyes the scouts for his heart / To a drawn sword of sharp, smooth iron.
If he shakes it in the bone of an adversary, there smile / The molars of the laughing mouths of death.
He sees loneliness as company, and the company as loneliness, and is guided / Where the mother of the tangled stars is guided.

Waddak bin Numayl Al-Mazini said:
Foremost, arrivors in fear, their step / With every thin two-edged Yemeni sword.
When they are called for help, they do not ask who called them / For which war, or in which place.

Qatari bin Al-Fuja'a Al-Mazini said:
I say to her (my soul) when she flew in scattered fear / From the heroes: Woe to you, do not be afraid.
For if you were to ask for the survival of a day / Beyond the term appointed for you, you would not be obeyed.
So patience in the field of death, patience / For attaining immortality is not possible.
Nor is the garment of survival a garment of honor / So the coward folds away the pen (of destiny - uselessly).
The path of death is the end of every living thing / And its caller calls to the people of the earth.
And whoever is not envied (for dying young/honorable) grows old and weary / And fate hands him over to interruption.
There is no good for a man in life / If he is counted among the fallen goods.

Sawwar bin Al-Mudharrib Al-Sa'di said:
And I remain a brother of wars / If I have not committed a crime, I am the shield for the criminal.

Qatari bin Al-Fuja'a Al-Mazini said:
Let no one lean towards refraining / On the day of battle, fearing death.
For I have seen myself as a target for spears / From my right once and from my front.
Then I turned away, having struck and not been struck / Fresh in insight, scarred in feet (experienced).

Harish bin Hilal Al-Quray'i said (and it is said to be by Al-Abbas bin Mirdas Al-Sulami):
We expose to the swords when we meet / Faces that are not exposed to slaps.
And I am not one to take off my clothes / When the warriors growl, nor do I throw them aside.
But the colt roams beneath me / To the raids with the sharp cutting sword.

Al-Shamaidhar Al-Harithi said:
O cousins, do not mention poetry after / You buried the rhymes in the desert of Al-Ghamir.
We are not like those you used to take from a basket / Who accept injustice or appoint a judge to rule.
But the rule of the sword is imposed among you / So we are pleased when the sword becomes pleased.
It saddened me what war dragged between us / O cousins, if only the matter were a debt.
If you claim that we were unjust, we were not / Unjust, but we were bad at demanding (payment/rights).

Al-Ashtar Al-Nakha'i said:
May my wealth not remain and may I deviate from height / And meet my guests with a frowning face.
If I do not launch a raid against Ibn Harb / That does not leave a day free from the plundering of souls.
Horses like ghouls, lean / Running with white swords, frowning in the hateful battle.
The iron heated up on them so it was like / The flash of lightning or the rays of suns.

Zafar bin Al-Harith Al-Kilabi said:
We used to think every white piece was fat / During the nights we met Judham and Himyar.
But when we struck the Nab' tree with the Nab' tree, one part / With another, its sticks refused to break.
We gave them a cup to drink, and they gave us the like / But they were more patient towards death.

Amr bin Ma'adi Karib said:
When I saw the horses aslant as if they were / Streams of crops released and flowing freely.
The soul boiled within me at the first moment / And returned to its disliked state, then settled.
Why do you say the spear is heavy on my shoulder / If I do not stab when the horses attack?
I remained as if I were a target for the spears / Fighting for the sons of Jurm while they fled.
If my people had made me speak with their spears / I would have spoken, but the spears silenced me.

Some of the Banu Bawlan from Tayy said:
We trapped the Banu Jadila in / A fire of war, blazing with fuel.
We kindle the arrows at the bottom / And we hunt souls built upon generosity.

Sayyar bin Qasir Al-Tai said:
If the mother of Al-Qadid had witnessed our stabbing / At Mar'ash, the horses of the Armenian would have neighed.
The evening I shoot at their gathering with his chest (the horse) / And my soul, I settled it, so it was reassured.

Qais bin Al-Khatim said:
I stabbed Ibn Abdul Qais a stabbing of revenge / It had a penetration; were it not for the ray, it would have illuminated it.
I possessed two hands with it, so I widened its tear / A standing one sees from this side what is behind it.

I was a man who would never hear a disgrace continuously / Being insulted by it, without lifting its cover.
Whenever this death comes, no need / Of my soul will be found unless I have decreed its decree.
For I am entrusted in the fierce war / With the advancing of a soul whose survival I do not desire.

Some of the Banu Asad said:
My hand bestowed upon Ibn Has'has bin Wahb / At the bottom of Dhu Al-Jadah, the hand of the noble.
And if I wished, I would have been from him / In the place of the two bright stars from the stars.
I remembered the distraction of the youths one day / And attaching blame to the blameworthy.

Al-Husayn bin Al-Humam Al-Murri said:
I delayed to preserve life, but I did not find / For myself a life like advancing.
We are not those whose wounds bleed on their heels / But on our feet the blood drips.
When I saw that patience had been blocked / Even if it was a day of stars, dark.
We were patient, and patience is our nature / With our swords cutting hand and wrist.
We split the heads of men who are dear / To us, but they were more disobedient and more unjust.
When I saw that love was not benefiting me / I resorted to the matter that was more decisive.
I am not one to buy life with humiliation / Nor one to climb a ladder out of fear of death.

Bishama bin Hazn said:
I am a man who marks poems for the enemies / Indeed, the worst of poems is their neglect.
My people are the children of fierce war with their gathering / And the Mashrafiyya (swords) and spears are its ignition.
It was still known for Murra in the battle / The drinking of spears, and upon them is their pouring.
From the era of Ad, it was known to us / Capturing kings, killing them, and fighting them.

A man from Banu Uqayl said (and his cousins fought him and he killed some of them):
Disliked by our chiefs, O family of Amr / We come to you early with a polished thin sword.
We weep when we kill you, over you / And we kill you as if we do not care.

Al-Qattal Al-Kilabi said:
I implored Ziyad while the assembly was between us / And reminded him of the wombs of Sa'd and Haitham.
When I saw that he was not desisting / I tilted my hand towards him with a straightened spear.
When I saw that I had killed him / I regretted him; what an hour of regret!

Qais bin Zuhair said:
I healed the soul from Haml bin Badr / And my sword healed me from Hudhayfa.
If I have cooled my burning thirst with them / I have cut nothing with them but my own fingers.

A Bedouin said (his brother killed his son):
I say to the soul, in consolation and comfort / One of my hands struck me and did not intend to.
Both are a successor after his companion / This is my brother when I call him, and that is my son.

Al-Harith bin Wa'la Al-Dhuhli said:
My people, they killed Umaym, my brother / So if I shoot, my arrow hits me.
If I forgive, I forgive a grave matter / And if I attack, I weaken my own bone.
Do not feel safe from a people you have wronged / And started with insults and spite.
If they pollinate palm trees for others / And the word is despised, yet it grows.
You claimed that we have no forbearance / Indeed, the stick is struck for the forbearing one (to warn him).

Another said:
If a tribe accepted money as ransom / We would have driven a flood of filled money to them.
But a people whose brother was killed refused / The acceptance of shame, so they chose blood over milk.

Some of the Banu Faq'as said:
Do not accept blood money from the people, for I / See shame remains, while blood monies go.
As if you did not precede a night of time / If you attained what you were seeking.

Al-Ahwas bin Muhammad said:
I am, despite what you know, envied / Growing on hatred and malice.
No befalling calamities afflict me / Except that they honor me and raise my status.
If it ceases, it ceases from a furious one / Whose outbursts are feared among peers.
I am, when men are hidden, found / Like the sun, not hidden in any place.

Some of the Banu Abd Shams said:
When they saw them rising from the valleys / Disheveled, their knights disheveled, their forelocks.
They took refuge there in the peaks, knowing / That the command of a seducer had been obeyed at night.

Hayyan bin Rabi'a Al-Tai said:
The tribes knew that my people / Are possessors of a body when the iron is worn.
And we are indeed the people of rhymes / When mutual repulsion and chanting blaze.
And we strike the dark battalion until / It turns away, and the swords are witnesses for us.

Amr bin Ma'adi Karib said:
I surely gather my legs on it (the horse) / In fear of death, and indeed I am a flee-er.
And I surely turn it back, unwilling / When the soul has a roar from death.
All of that is a character of mine / And of all, in fear, I am capable.

And Ibn Subh, bewildered, threatens me / He has no protector among people as long as I live.

Another said (and his cousins struck a client of his named Hawshab):
If I am not shot at, and my quiver is shot at / The swerving arrows hit my flank and shoulder.
Wake up, Banu Hazn, for our desires are together / And our wombs are connected, not cut.
If you resurrect it (the feud), you resurrect it blameworthy / Ugly in mention of the outcome for the tracker.
I will take revenge from you, family of Hazn, for Hawshab / Even if he was a client of mine and you were sons of my father.

A man from Banu Asad said:
I say to my soul when its young ostrich (fear) bolted / Hold your place, why do you fear when there is cause for fear?
Hold your place, look at what will clear / The absence of this shining cloud.

Musa bin Jabir Al-Hanafi said:
Did you not see that I protected my reality (honor) / And engaged the edge of death, while death was before it?
I found a soul that cannot be matched by generosity / And I said, 'Be reassured,' when its thoughts were bad.
What good is wealth whose owner does not avoid blame / And the soul of a man which he does not demean for its right?

Harith bin Jabir said:
By your life, you were not fair to me when you imposed on me / Your passion with the client, while I have no passion.
If the client is wronged, I panic for his wrong / And it moves my entrails, and my dogs bark.

Abdullah bin Sabra said:
When Gemini rises high and the Star (Pleiades) is rising / Then all the fords of the Euphrates are crossings.
And indeed, if the prince is stingy with his permission / I am capable of permission from myself if I wish.

Some of the Banu Qais bin Tha'labah said:
I called Banu Sa'd to me, so they rolled up their sleeves / Chiefs from Sa'd, long of forearms.
When the hearts of people flew in fear / Of death, they anchored with noble souls.

Shammas bin Aswad Al-Tahawi said:
Did it deceive you one day that Ibn Darim said / 'And you are excluded as the mangy camel is excluded from the herd?'
Naws judged among you with what attached to others / Thus the mighty, the trained, disgraces you.
So return to Qais bin Hassan his camels / And you did not attain dates, or they are sweeter.
Do not join the womb of Ibn Amr bin Marthad / A tested sharp sword teaches you the joining of the womb.

Hujr bin Khalid said:
We found our father settled his house in glory / And its ascents tired other men.
Whoever of us strives does not attain the like of his striving / But whenever he departs, he is his follower.
Our second prevails over whoever equals us, and our first / Prevails over all of Ma'add, as long as he defends.
We are those whose neighbor is not frightened / While some of them are deaf to treachery.
We protected our sanctuary, and our spears permitted / The sanctuary of every tribe, seeking refuge in its grazing lands.

Rabi'a bin Maqrum Al-Dabbi said:
Your brother, your brother is he who draws near and you hope for / His affection, and if called, he answers.
If you fight, he fights whom you hate / And his weapon increases in closeness to you.
I was such that if I pulled my rope against my peer / He died, or followed the pull.
If I perish, possessors of rage whose flame / Against me almost blazes fiercely (will rejoice).
Like me, so witness the secret gathering and announce / Me to the enemies and the angry people.
For the threateners see before me / Lions, hidden, thick-necked.

Bishr bin Al-Mughira bin Al-Muhallab said:
The prince shunned me, and Al-Mughira shunned / And Yazid's side has turned away from me.
All of them have attained satiety for their bellies / And the satiety of a youth is baseness if his companion is hungry.
O uncle, go easy, and take me for a calamity / That befalls, for time is full of calamities.
I am the sword, except that the sword has a bluntness / And the like of me, its striking edges are not blunt against you.

Sulmi bin Rabi'a said:
Tumadir claimed that if I die / Her young sons will fill my place.
Dust be on your hands! Have you seen for his people / Anyone like me in my ease and when you blame me?
A man who, when calamities cover him / Is sufficient for a dilemma, even if it is great.
And the place of a descending disaster I sufficed, and a knight / My spear drank from his back and rose.
And when the virgins veiled themselves with smoke / And hastened to set up the pots, so I roasted.
Keys circulated with the provisions of the poor / In my hands from the hump of the large camels.
I saw the rift of the clan between them / And I sufficed its offender in all matters.
I forgave the ignorant one among them and supported them / With my advice, and the clan did not suffer from my slip.
I sufficed my black client for my crime / And withheld my grazing livestock for the friend.

Abdullah bin Anama Al-Dabbi said:
If you ask for the right, we give the right to its asker / While the armor is bagged and the sword is near.

And if you refuse, then we are a proud people / We do not taste humiliation; indeed, poison is drunk.
So restrain your donkey, do not let it graze in our garden / Otherwise, the tether of the donkey will return distressed.

Ma'bad bin Alqama said:
Say to Zuhair: If you insult our chiefs / We are not insulters of the one who seeks insults.
But we refuse oppression and strike / With every thin two-edged, determined sword.
Our hands are ignorant (violent) but our opinion dreams (is forbearing) / And we insult with actions, not with speech.
The persistence in what was between us / Suffices you, so delay for it or advance.

Aban bin Abda said:
If religion is destroyed by corruption, then say to him / Leave us and a head from Ma'add we will clash with.
With an army whose piebald horses get lost in its sides / Its rear in Yathrib and its front in Sham.
If we march between east and west / The awake dust and the sleeping dust move.

Al-Karous bin Zaid said:
She saw me when gray hair dressed me, so she hoped / To dispense with me; so be hoping for the best hoper.
If Ma'qil rejoiced at me in my old age / Indeed, the midwives rejoiced at me before them.

Another said in the same meaning:
The mark of glory and height was evident in him / As a newborn, ransomed between the hands of the midwives.

Qawal Al-Tai said:
Say to this man who came striving / Come, for the Mashrafi sword cuts the shoulder muscles.
We have a sour plant of death soaked / And you are lacking, so are you sour?
I think you, without the wealth you came seeking / Will be met by white swords that seize souls.

Waddah bin Ismail (known as Waddah Al-Yaman) said:
If you saw the horses running / Frowning, taking the dust as a tail.
You would have seen upon the backs of the horses Jinn / Gaining spoils and missing giving.

Al-Qattal Al-Kilabi said:
When he intends an intent, the night does not cover his grief / Nor are the mounts difficult for him.
Sturdy, noble in nature and character / Upon the best of what natures are built.
If he hungers, he does not rejoice at a meal of an hour / Nor does he despair at its loss while he is hungry.
He sees that after hardship is ease, and does not see / If there is ease, that it is a permanent fate.

Another said:
The slave among us does not carry more than his capacity / While we carry what the rocky mountains do not carry.
Among us is patience, and some people think us / Slow, but in our slowness is speed.

Al-Mutalammis bin Abdul Masih said:
Do you not see that man is a hostage of death / Thrown to the scavenging birds or will be buried?
So do not accept injustice for fear of death / And die with it free, while your skin is smooth.
Whoever seeks revenge, his nose is not cut / Short, and Bayhas waded into death with the sword.
An ostrich, when the people threw down his kin / It became clear in his clothes how he dresses.
If they approach with love, we approach with the like / Otherwise, we are more refusing and more sunny (proud/fierce).

Sa'd bin Nashib Al-Mazini said:
She criticizes me for what she sees of my fierceness / And the intensity of my soul, Umm Sa'd, and she does not know.
So I said to her: Indeed, the forbearing one, even if he is sweet / Is found in a state more bitter than aloe.
In softness is weakness, and fierceness is awe / And whoever is not feared carries upon a rough mount.
It is not that I am harsh to the one who is soft to me / But I am harsh and refusing against compulsion.
I straighten the deviation of the inclination until I return it / And I muzzle him until he returns to the measure.
If you blame me, blame me for a tragedy / Noble in news of hardship, sharing in ease.
When he intends, he casts his resolve between his eyes / And determines with the determination of the Surayji sword with the mark.
He also said:
Do not threaten us, O Bilal, for we / Even if we have not split the stick of religion / Are free.
We have, if we fear you, a way / To where we do not fear you, and time has phases.
So do not carry us, after hearing and obedience / To a limit where there is schism or shame.
For we, when war casts off its mask / Are righteous to it when its sons shun it.
We are not occupiers of a house of oppression / For fear of death, if the house repels us.

Qarar bin Abbad said:
If a man does not get angry for him when they get angry / Knights who, if told 'Ride death', they ride.
And mighty people do not surround him with victory / Rushing into the matter that is feared.
The nearest enemy devours him, and he remains / Even if he was protected, struck by injustice.
So be brother in the state of peace to whom you wish, and know / That other than your client in war is a stranger.

And your client, your client is the one whom if you call / He answers you willingly while blood pours.
So do not forsake the client, even if he is unjust / For by him matters are repaired and mended.

Abu Kudam Al-Taymi said:
To God belongs Taym! What a spear of chase / Death met with it, and a decisive stroke.
And a kindler of war, advancing, exposing himself / To death, not turning away or deviating.
Humiliating his soul when lies / Fear of death, the courage of the courageous.
I gave him the cup of death with spearheads / Sharp, honed edges.
As if my hand was his death / When I turned back with it upon an appointment.

Shubayl Al-Ghazari said (and his nephews fought him so he killed them):
O my sorrow for those whom I used to call / And they would suffice me, and their arm was strong.
They were not overcome due to humiliation, but / Thus lions are preyed upon by lions.

Qatari bin Al-Fuja'a Al-Mazini said:
O you who seek the duel, come near / I will water you with instant, peeling death.
There is no shame in sharing death in war / For its drinkers; so give me to drink from it and drink.

Waddak bin Numayl Al-Mazini said:
My soul is a ransom for the Banu Mazin / From a sun in war, thirsty heroes.
To death, if they are given a choice / Between consequences and fighting.
They protected their sanctuary and rose among them / In the high peaks of honor.

Aws bin Tha'laba said:
Judham, the rope of passion is past when / Obsessions of worry begin to recur after sleep.
No night frowned upon me, nor country / Nor did a journey hinder me from my need.

Sawwar said:
O Janub, if you had seen my knights / With the sword when the evils raced.
The wideness of the road for fear that they be captured / While the horses followed them, and they were fleeing.
They call Sawwar when the spears turn red / And for every day of battle there is a Sawwar.

Abu Hazaba (or Ibn Hazaba) Al-Taymi said:
Prepared for death, disfigured when / The scoundrel lowers his two garments to the foot.
He waded into death among the enemies boldly with his blade / While the horses chew the fold of death with the bridles.
They are hundreds of thousands, and he is in a group / High-nosed, strikers of the obscure brave ones.

Another said:
O Ajl, hasten the killers with their revenge / A stranger with us from the tribes of Yahsub.
You committed a crime and were unjust when you took for your right / A stranger, you claimed, destitute, not guilty.
You did not attain revenge nor did you go with what / You did, O Banu Ajl, to a valid direction.
Killing a criminal absent from his helper is not / For a seeker of revenge a path of pursuit.
But you feared the spearheads of Mazin / So you swerved away from them to another shoulder.
You tasted us time after time / And the knowledge of the clarity of a man is with the experienced.

A man from Banu Numayr said:
I am the son of the fourth ones from the family of Amr / And the knights of the pulpits from Janab.
We expose to the swords when we meet / Faces that are not exposed to insults.
My fathers are the chiefs of Banu Numayr / And my maternal uncles are the chiefs of Banu Kilab.

Al-Hadhlul bin Ka'b Al-Ghanawi said:
She says, striking her chest with her right hand / 'Is this my husband, with the retreating millstone?'
I said to her: Do not hasten and clarify / My trial when the knights turn against me.
By the life of your father, the good one, I am a servant / To my guest, and if I ride, I am a knight.
And I buy praise, seeking its profit / And I leave my peer while he is ashamed, sleepy.
I carry the heavy burden and milk / The udders of death when the plunger flees.
I treat the knocking worries with determination / When the whispers increase for the knocking ones.

Qabisa bin Jabir Al-Nasrani Al-Jarmi said:
We have the two fortresses of Aja and Salma / And their eastern parts, without plagiarism.
And Tayma, which from the era of Ad / We protected with the tips of the spears.
I tested matters and they tested me / As if I were in the past nations.

Salem bin Wabisa said:
Stick to moderation in what you do / Affectation comes short of true character.
A position like the edge of a sword I stood in / Protecting the sanctuary while eyes shot at me.
I did not slip, nor did I commit an indecency / When men slipped on the likes of it.

Amir bin Al-Tufayl said:
God decreed in some hateful things for the youth / Guidance, and in some passion what is feared.
Did you not know that when the oath leads me / To injustice, I do not engage, for the oath is unjust?

Al-Akhnas bin Shihab Al-Taghlibi said:
To God belongs a people like my people, a band / When the bands gather at the kings.
They strike the ram (leader), his helmet shines / On his face are streaks of blood.
If our swords fall short, their connection is / Our steps to our enemies, so we strike.
We are people, there is no barrier in our land / With the rain, where it is found, and who is victorious?
You see the grazing horses around our houses / Like the goats of Hijaz, the pens lacked them.
I see every people looking at them / And the forelocks fall short of what they do.
Every people approached the tether of their stallion / But we took off his tether so he is roaming.

Al-Udayl bin Al-Farkh Al-Ajli said:
I remained giving grief to drink to my brothers, those whose / Father is my father in jest and in seriousness.
It is enough sadness that I still see the spears / Spitting blood from my arm and from my upper arm.
By my life, if I intended to go out against them / With Qais against Qais and Awf against Sa'd.
And I wasted Amr and Al-Rabab and Darim / And Adwan, and loved how I am patient from love.
I would have been like the spiller of what is in his water-skin / For the shimmering mirage on a hard hill.
Like a wet-nurse to children of another, having wasted / The sons of her womb; this is straying from the intent.
The dust of my feet, if I gathered its dust / Is not more than the sons of Nizar in number.
They are the two sides of the earth; if they were shaken / What is between the south and the dam would shake.
And I, even if I opposed them and shunned them / My liver feels pain from what bites their livers.

A woman from Banu Amir said:
If my thought is true, and it is truthful to me / About you, and small dreams you have.
Our spears will count the slaughter of camels among you / And hold onto the livers, broken.

Qatada bin Muslima Al-Hanafi said:
She came early to me out of foolishness, blaming me / Foolishly; she incapacitates her husband and blames.
When she saw me, having lost my knights / And exhaustion and wounds appeared on my body.
I was not the first to be hit by a calamity / Of time; and a fierce, pure-blooded tribe.
I fought them until their gathering was equal / And the horses were swimming in paths of blood.
With me are lions from Hanifa in the battle / For the swords above their heads have a mark.
If I remain, I will depart on a raid / Towards the spoils, or a noble one will die.

A man from Banu Yashkur said:
If you are pleased, then we are pleased / And if you refuse, the tips of the spears are straightened.
And white, thin swords / Cutting off skulls and the fingers of palms.

Jurayba bin Al-Ashyam Al-Faq'asi said:
If time bites you with its fangs / In evil, then bite it as it bit.
Do not be found in its evil fearing / As if you are in it a spreader of illness.
We offered combat, but they did not descend / And combat was a calamity upon them.
They likened our horses to wild donkeys / But they found their provision causing indigestion.

Al-Qutami said:
Whoever civilization pleases / Which men of the desert do you see us as?
Whoever ties donkeys, indeed among us are / Spears that rob and beautiful horses.
We used to raid Janab / And they lacked plunder wherever they were.
We raided from Al-Dabab on settled people / And Dabba, whoever perished, perished.
And sometimes on Bakr, our brother / When we did not find anyone but our brother.

A man from Banu Himyar said:
They refused to permit their neighbor to their enemy / While the benefit of death rose until it overflowed.
They were like the nose of the lion, not smelled unwillingly / Nor did he ever catch prey until he was dusted.

Abbas bin Mirdas Al-Sulami said:
I have not seen a tribe like the tribe in the morning / Nor like us the day we met as knights.
More repeating (attacks) and more protecting of the reality than them / And more striking of skulls with swords.

Ibn Faris recited for Hajal bin Nadla Al-Bahili:
Shaqiq came exposing his spear / Indeed, among your cousins are spears.
Did time cause a calamity to us / Or did the mother of Shaqiq elevate a weapon?

Shatim bin Khuwaylid Al-Fazari said:
They are the fire, burning whoever touches it / So if you wish, roast in it and taste.
They manage from the inheritance of their fathers / Dreams (minds) with which they patch the tears.

Awfa bin Atiya said:
Is it over a herd of twenty or less / You peeled your stick? So look at what you peel.
You returned and did not attain what you sought / Behold, the comer of his error while he sees.

Sa'd bin Malik bin Al-Uqaysir Al-Azdi said:

When you meet me, a lean / Dark bay or a white-footed horse runs with my cloth.
You meet a man whom if you meet, with his sword / The days will teach you what you were ignorant of.

Mafruq bin Amr Al-Shaybani said:
Ask Quda'a if I fulfilled my covenant / Or if I wasted the pledge when I took charge.
Many heroes I met with the like of them / So I gave them the cup of death and was given.
I will seek glory without falling short / If I die, I die; and if I live, I live.

Ja'far bin Ulba Al-Harithi said:
As if the Uqaylis on the day I met them / Were chicks of sandgrouse meeting a hawk.
The Uqaylis screamed on the day I met them / The scream of sore-backed camels meeting a healer.
There is no need behind me except that I / Wished Ma'adh was among those who came to us.
So the lying soul speaks truth about my bravery / And works blindly that we have seen.

A man from Banu Darim said:
We are people whose heads fill the helmets / And we are disciples when we march to battle.
The black rust is better to us / Than musk mixed by mixing palms.
Our skins laugh at the feel of armor / When a dark-colored, eclipsed day comes.
Our swords hang like pillars / And between them and the ankle are wide spaces.
Our skulls on the day of meeting are with our head / Walking to death without inclination.

Ka'b bin Malik Al-Ansari said:
The blades of swords, if they fall short of our step / We advance, and we attach them if they do not attach.
We leave skulls with exposed crowns / Forget the palms, as if they were not created.

Jabir bin Zaid said:
Sons of today? No, rather yesterday their father was / Through us they refrained from being oppressed and digested.
When we repelled every ignorant one from them / And defended them from who was oppressing yesterday.
They wanted what was beneath it for their seducer / If he sought it one day, a blazing fire.
So gently, sons of today, the challengers! Before you / Our enemies warned each other then refrained.
Beware, for if our seriousness becomes serious / You will taste mixed poison and colocynth.
Whoever quarrels across the spears / Is a guide to the unvisited watering holes, slapped.

Durid bin Al-Simma said:
I am their brother in every calamity / If I die, they will not find a brother like me.
My soul gives generously to them with what my hand owns / And my victory; so no obscenity against them nor my stinginess.
A client, I repelled the attack from him out of generosity / And if I wished, he would have ended up closing his eyes on my revenge.
But I protect the sanctuary and belong / To the pursuit of fathers who grew my honor before me.

Nafi' bin Khalifa Al-Ghanawi said:
Among the best of what is in us is that we / When we meet a day of patience, we are patient.
We settle our souls on the day of preservation / For what is known and denied.
If our souls order us to retreat / We say to them: You did not flee when there was a place to flee.

Al-Darraj Al-Dabbabi said:
Convey to Abu Amr when you meet them / The signs of my attacks when the horses stumble.
When I entered the prison, I was certain that / It is the separation, not the separation of distance that then gathers.
The prison did not make me cry, nor did the shackles weaken me / Nor do I panic from fear of death, O people.
But I fear for groups / If I die, that you give what I used to prevent.
So do not humble yourselves to the people for fear of death / For every youth there is a day of death and a falling place.

Jadhl bin Ashmat Al-Abdi said:
O you woman, how long will the blame and criticism be / Do not deny a man whose clothes are torn.
If I pass the evening alone, the full moon is alone / The lion is alone, and the sword is alone.
Or if you denied my two garments because they are worn / The sea has specks and foam on top of it.
Or if the turning of nights turned you away from other than him / Indeed, under my clothes is a lion.
Do not ask the people about my wealth and its amount / But ask the people what is my utility and my character.
I give the spearhead its share in the morning of fear / And the shaft of the spear I quench with blood.
The people know that I am among their best / When the sight of the trembling coward rises.
A man may be poor one day while he is of noble lineage / And the flocks of the helpless fool may increase.
Wealth increases one day after its scarcity / And the branch is clothed with leaves after dryness.

Ibn Al-Atnaba said:
My chastity refused, and my trial refused / And my taking praise at a profitable price.
And my advancing my soul to the hateful / And my striking the head of the attacking hero.
And my saying whenever it heaved and boiled (in fear) / 'Hold your place, you will be praised or rest.'

To defend righteous feats / And protect from a distance a sound honor.
With a striped sword, like the color of salt, pure / And a soul that does not settle on the ugly.

Another said:
Whenever you shake the Banu Qatan, you find them / Swords, on their shoulders are swords.
Sitting in their councils, dignified / And if a guest descends, they are guests.
If they descend, you think them full moons / And if they ride, they are deaths.

Another said:
Forbidden to our spears is stabbing a retreating one / And chests are broken advancing in the chests.
Safe, the rears of my horses in the battle / Wounded, their breasts and throats.

Another said:
He meets swords with his face and his throat / And sets up his skull in the place of the helmet.
And he says to the side: Be patient for the edge of the spears / For you would demolish the pillar of glory if you were not hamstrung.
When he contemplates the figure of an approaching guest / Wearing the garment of a dusty night.
He signaled to the large camel: This is a night visitor / The enemies will slaughter me if you are not slaughtered.

Another said:
When fear snatches souls from men / We make the high souls patient for death.
Beware of the tales which, if they are seen / Tie disgraces to the necks of men.

Jabir bin Hana Al-Taghlibi said:
We give kings peace as long as they intend us / And killing them is not forbidden to us.
People see from us the skin of a shedding snake / And the fur of a lion from the lions.

Another said:
So he humbled the necks of the difficult ones with his might / And the necks of the seekers of dew with favors.
His hands did not contract except with a sharp sword / Nor did his hands expand except with a gift.

Another said:
A youth whose time is two halves in what befalls him / In his might is a half and in his generosity is a half.
There is no speck in his eye against seekers of good / Nor is there deafness in his ear against the roar of the lion.

Damra bin Damra said:
Upon it are warriors and protectors; among them / One hunted by the tips of spears and a hunter.
I let the friend taste my compassion and protection / And distant enemies may complain of my touch.
And a possessor of a nose ring (pride), I pained him and preceded him / So his striving fell short of me while he was striving.
The people knew that my origin / Is high when the found hills are counted.

Amr bin Ma'adi Karib said:
The proud protectors knew that I / Smile when I am called to stabbing.
And a clumsy one I left at a place of attack / Upon him are streaks of purple (blood).
The practice of war did not weaken my pillar / But what has aged of time.

Abdul Aziz bin Zurara Al-Kilabi said:
I have lived in time in phases on paths / Various, so I encountered from it softness and roughness.
The matter does not fill my chest before its occurrence / Nor does my capacity narrow with it when it occurs.
Both I wore, so neither did comfort make me arrogant / Nor did I humble myself from its hardships in panic.

Kharasha bin Amr said:
Chiefs who grew us in ancient branches / Occupying the place of glory wherever it moved.
Swordsmen, strikers in the palm of war / When the distressed screamer is covered and pierced.
We are, in all conditions, more noble in character / And better for the meetings that remain and the first.
And longest in remaining in the house of preservation / And most tied in dreams (minds) when the vegetation makes (people) ignorant.
And more of us as a master and son of a master / And more worthy to say and to do.

Umama bint Al-Jalah said:
If you wish to meet a youth whom if you weighed / With every Ma'addi and every Yamani.
And in obscure matters, patience, generosity, and sovereignty / And might; then this is Al-Aswad bin Qinan.
A noble, more pious than Nizar and Ya'rub / And the most trustworthy in contract by the word of tongue.
And the most fulfilling of covenant and longest of hand / And highest of mention in every place.
As if gifts and deaths in his palm / Are two clouds, joined and compatible.

Bishr bin Awana said (having met a lion):
O Fatimah, had you witnessed in the belly of Khabt / When the lion met your brother Bishr.
Then you would have seen a lion seeking a lion / A thick-necked lion covering a thick-necked lion.
He swaggered when my colt retreated from him / In caution, so I said: You have hamstrung a colt.
Let my foot attain the back of the earth, for I / Saw the earth more stable than you as a back.
And I said to him when he showed blades / Sharpened and a frowning face.
He indicates with a claw and a sharp fang / And with glances you would think were coals.
In my right hand is a sharp edge that left / Through its striking in the clash of war, a mark.
Did the news not reach you of what its blades did / At Kazima the morning I struck Amr?
My heart is like your heart; I do not fear / An assault, nor do you fear panic.
You seek food for the cubs / And I seek a dowry for the daughter of the uncles.

So why do you compel the like of me to turn back / And place the soul in your hands by force?
I advised you, so seek other than me to feed you / Food, for indeed my flesh is bitter.
When he thought my words were deception / And opposed me as if I spoke nonsense.
He walked and I walked; from two lions who sought / A goal that was rugged when they sought it.
I shook the sword at him, thinking that I / Shook with it a dawn in the darkness.
He fell stained with blood, as if I / Demolished with it a towering building.
I found for him in a bubbling soul that he saw / When I belied what he wished of treachery.
And I said to him: It is dear to me that I / Killed my equal in toughness and force.
But you sought something that no one sought / But you, so I could not bear it, O lion.
You try to teach me fleeing / By the life of my father, you tried a strange thing.
So do not panic, for you met a free man / Who fears to be blamed, so die free.

Al-Zubair bin Bakkar said:
Be patient, for every youth must be snatched away / And death is easier than what you hoped to burden yourself with.
Death is easier than giving a deficiency / If you do not die young/healthy, the end is old age.

Abu Dawud said:
How many a mighty army we raided / And how many a selected chief we killed.
So ask about us when the tribe winters / And ask about us when the might descends.

Ibn Harma said:
If it is said: Which youth do you know / More cheerful to stabbing with the spear?
And more striking of heads on the day of battle / And more feeding in the barren time?
The palms of the servants pointed to you / The pointing of the drowning to the shore.

Another said:
Your standing under the shades of swords / Settled the Caliphate in its house.
As if you look into hearts / When they whisper their secrets.
In your palms are death and dew / And both act obedient to their provider.
The decrees of God are inevitable / And you are the executor of their measure.

Al-A'war Al-Shanni said:
We abstain and feed fat to our guest / When we do not find likes in the houses of the people.
We strike the ram (leader) while his battalions turn green / A striking on the dwellings of inspiration (heads), ringing.
If masters among us are hit, indeed we have / White swords, generous on the day of fear, heroes.
They defend the women of the tribe if they come early / Horses dragging the source of the sun in succession.

Ma'qil bin Amir Al-Asadi said:
And a day as if those warming themselves at its heat / Even if there were no coals, were standing on coals.
We were patient for it until it cleared, and indeed / The days of hatefulness are relieved by patience.

Another said:
Little harm except to the peer in battle / Many favors, wide of capacity in grace.
He is forbearing as long as forbearance does not milk humiliation / And we are ignorant (violent) if the powers of forbearance are tied with ignorance.

Nahik bin Asaf Al-Harithi said:
Whoever practices terrors in seeking riches / Lives wealthy or dies in what he practices.
Youths of truth I guarded from death / And there is no guardian for him whom God does not guard.

Al-Muraqqish Al-Akbar said:
Why did you not ask about us, the knights of Wa'il / For we are the fastest to their enemies.
And we are the most numerous when pebbles are counted / And ours are the precedents and the glory of their banner.

Shabib bin Al-Barsaa said:
The backs (ends) of matters become clear when they pass / And their fronts approach looking like them.
There is no good in sticks except the hard ones / Nor in rising birds except the hawks.

Abdullah bin Dhabyan said:
Mus'ab sees that I forgot a distant one / And miserable, by God's life, is what Mus'ab thought.
By God, I do not forget him as long as a sun rises / And as long as a star shines in the dark of night.
Shall I raise my head amidst Bakr bin Wa'il / While I have not quenched my sword with pouring blood?

Al-Musawir bin Hind said:
I became like the sword whose scabbard wore out / The era of the smith is old, yet it is sharp.
Did you not know, O Abs, if you thank me / When the defenders turned, how I defended?
Did you not know that I am laughing towards you / And in severe matters, I am severe?

Another said:
Shall we surrender our client while our horses did not run / To their horses until blood stained them?
We witnessed and tested many matters / Do not despise the knowledge of a man who is older.

Kardam said:
They are the feeders of the hump of the large camels / And the fat in the cold nights.
They break the chests of spears / While the horses are chased and chasing.

Another (Wa'la Al-Jazi as in Al-Wajnat and Al-Samt) said:
What is the matter with him whom I strive to mend his break / Preserving honor, while he seeks out of his foolishness to break me?
I return to the guilty and ignorant among them / With my forbearance, even if I punished, my sea would drown them.

Patience, forbearance, and waiting for them tomorrow / For I am not the weak nor the humble inexperienced.
I think the changes of time between me and them / Will carry them from me on a rugged mount.

Qutba bin Al-Khadra said:
If you meet a battalion, advance / For the advancer is not the loser.
You receive a greeting or die by a stab / And death comes to who is far and avoids.

Al-Kumait bin Zaid said:
We are defenders of our sanctuaries / When it is a day of frowning, dusty face.
Our bond is preserved by our spears / When the seeker of protection wastes the bond.
Our right hands are extended with our swords / Closing in on the day of battle when drawn.
Our honors are covered by our lives / What good is an honor not preserved and covered?

Al-Kumait bin Ma'ruf said:
Slow to indecency, they do not attend it / Swift to the caller of the repeated cry.
Revivers for the client, generous with hospitality / Sharp swords under the blazing cloud.
He also said:
Nawfal grew me for noble deeds / And the two Khalids, Ma'bad, and Al-Azhar.
O Lord, many a tyrant whose head we struck / We strike the head of whoever acts tyrannically.
The advancers when battalions retreat / The turning ones when the shelter is sought.
We deny in the day of battle, and our spears / Are red in tips when the denied covers.

Abu Muslim said:
I attained by opinion and secrecy what / The kings of Banu Marwan were incapable of when they sat.
I kept striving against them in their homes / While the people were in heedlessness in Sham, sleeping.
Until I struck them with the sword and they woke up / From a sleep no one had slept before them.
Whoever grazes sheep in a land full of lions / And sleeps on them, the lion takes charge of their grazing.

Al-Harith bin Zalim bin Jadhimah said:
I swear, were it not for exposing oneself before him / A sharp sword would have mixed with what is in the iron (helmet).
I rose with the possessor of snakes (sword) over the parting of his head / And no one rides the hateful except the noble.

Khalid bin Ja'far bin Kilab said:
No sanctuary except every white sharp sword / And every Rudayni spear and lean mare.
And a short-haired horse like the wolf, sewn at his arm / Forbidden to delay, wide of hocks.

Al-Afwah Al-Awdi said:
Two friends, our affair is different / I want height and he seeks fat.
I want the blood of Banu Malik / And Al-Mu'alla is pleased by the whiteness of milk.

Khalid bin Zuhair Al-Hudhali said:
Shorten, and let not a cloud take you from me / Its thunder scares the grazing ones away from us.
Do not awaken the viper rotating its head / Leave it when its sand hides it.

Another said:
I held my horse and soul in a strait / Preserving the clan and being patient.
I raised with it the defense of the protectors of Qais / And the best of people is he who raises the defense.
I established their glory as long as I lived / And I am not inheriting shame if I die.

Another said:
Did you not know—and knowledge benefits its people / And he who knows is not like another who does not know.
When the Pleiades shone in its dust / Above the people like the traveling companions.
And Gemini followed, its arrangement shining / Like the color of wild cows in their inhabited pastures.
That we are upon our ease without ignorance / And we are upon our hardship among the people of patience.

A man from Banu Mazin said:
We engage deaths in war, and you do not see / For those who do not engage them, an escape from death.
Brother of floods, his heart is not scared / When death wears death and wraps a turban.

Malik bin Al-Rayb said:
I am not distant from anger in battle / Nor the fearful in peace, committing crimes.
Nor the waiter for consequences in what / I intend of the lethal resolutions.
But I am of sharp resolve, advancing / Upon the floods of the ancient incident.
Little twitching of opinion in seriousness and passion / Gathered of heart at the fall of calamities.

Hatim bin Suhaym said:
Has it reached the people of Iraq, our stopping place? / We divide among people misery and blessings.
With a white sword to which the crown is tied, glorious / And youths of truth who do not fear being destitute.
We strike the chief of the battalion in the battle / And we ride the tips of spears out of honor.

Abdullah bin Dhakwan said:
There is no doctrine in my heart / Except white swords splitting the skulls.
Do not be content with taking half from them / For half is the share of the lowest ones.

Amr bin Umar said:
The morning the people of Iraq came as if they were / From the sea, a deep wave piled up.
We came all in iron as if we were / A cloud of autumn pushed by the south winds.

They departed and we had attained the chiefs of their men / And there is no calculator for the evil we attained.

Tawba bin Mudarras said:
The tragedies console the youth while he is incapable / And the turns of time play with the decisive, strong one.
I am a man whose strength is not broken by incapacity / When the heart folds within me on hatred.

Al-Quhayf bin Humayr Al-Uqayli said:
The groups of Bakr bin Wa'il met / And Hazzan in the valley, a blind harm.
When we get angry, a Mudar anger / We tear the veil of the sun or it drips blood.

Bujayr bin Bajra said:
I wish Abu Bakr could see what our swords / And what they harvest of wrist and necks.
Did you not see that God on the day of Baraja / Poured upon the disbelievers a whip of punishment?
As if they, while the horses followed their remnant / Were locusts blown by the wind on a foggy day.
When we finished striking a battalion / We rose to another like it with striking.

Mas'ud bin Mu'attib said:
The possessor of the Talh tree knows that we are with it / Lions raising their cubs.
I prepared for love a lean mare / Dragging her tails to death.

Qais bin Al-Khatim said:
If you meet the men of Aws, you meet / The blood of snakes and the fangs of a leopard.
We speak truth in the morning when we meet / Even if the morning is a hell of coals.

Hassan bin Thabit said:
I am not a nurturer if there does not visit you / Through the houses, a crushing, burning force.
The mighty submits to it when he sees it / And the fetus falls from fear of it.
Did we not leave painful funerals / Having a wailing over your chiefs?

Some Arabs said:
They knew that war is not / For the owners of censers and perfume.
We struck for Islam until / We established you on the clear path.

Rabi'a bin Maqrum said:
If a man of us commits a crime, it is as if he is / From fear, on the shoulders of Yadhbul.
I entered the structures of kings upon them / And the worst speech of a man is what he does not do.

Urwa bin Zaid Al-Khail said:
I emerged to the people of Qadisiyyah marked / And not everyone who covers the battle is marked.
God saved me, the term, and my bravery / And a cutting strike to the heroes of the Persians.
I killed a knight after a knight among them / And not everyone who meets the battalion is safe.

A man from Banu Asad said:
Qais and Khindif knew that we / Protected them with sharp cutting swords.
There was still among us in Qudays a patient one / We strike boldly for the furthest clans.
From early morning until the night came between them / And they succeeded in the other raiding nights.

Dharih, one of Banu Taym Allat, said:
When the horses saw spears tightening their chests / And arrows, I held the wing patient.
As if the swords of India around his chest / Were flashes of rain appearing from Tihama.

Abu Maryam Al-Bajali said:
The noble did not blame my covenant with you / Nor did the mean praise my character.
If a crack branches out, they mend it / And what they cracked has no mending.
I see through the ash the flash of an ember / Worthy of having a flame.
For fire is kindled by two flintstones / And war is preceded by speech.

Amr bin Ma'adi Karib said:
I witnessed his chase with a lean, strong / Firmly built, balanced horse.
The knights say to him when they see him / We see a fiber rope tighter on spears.
When they stand to bridle him / He stretches over sound pillars.
We bereaved the wife of her separation / And left the virgin for marriage.

Abu Masruq bin Al-Ajda' said:
The women of Hamdan knew that I / Am not a forsaker of them on the morning of fear.
I give my soul in the battle, and I / Am not a giver of it in other than the battle.

Hazn bin Kahf bin Abi Haritha said:
Is it from the wealth of my neighbor you went to gather riches / And push poverty away from yourself, O Ibn Muhallim?
You approached the matter from other than its face / And missed, out of ignorance, the direction of the gainer.
We are not a people whose sanctuary is permitted / Nor is the neighbor among us, if you knew, surrendered.
Whenever we are called to death, we come to it / Wading to it a deep sea of blood.

Hazn bin Amir Al-Tai said:
A tribe protecting the lands of Ghawth / On the lean, protected horses.
Their dress when they are frightened is armor / Its scales like the eyes of locusts.

Zamil bin Musad Al-Qayni said:
Whoever is nonsense in the meeting, we are / Possessors of hospitality at the meeting and truth.

With a striking that removes heads from their resting places / And stabbing like the mouths of perforated water skins.

Ubayd bin Qamas said:
I am striking, when the horses retreat / With my sword, many a glowing helmet.
I was such that if a house was harsh to me, I left it / To another, and did not sit in other than a seat (of honor).

Umar bin Yarbu' Al-Ghanawi said:
Did you not protect Najd with sharpened / Noble horses competing with their knights?
And white sharp swords / Cutting armor with their bodies.
And high, quivering spears / Spilling blood with their tips.
We married their women by force / With the white of the blade and their flexibility.
Noses of the fallen, the winds drag / The tails over them in their roaming.

Al-Ayyar bin Muhriz Al-Mazini said:
We do not graze on peace or ease / When the difficulties of men low (like cattle).
But we are the children of hardship in it / We traversed time, state after state.
Through us the matter is turned to the client / And we cauterize the disease of the one with incurable disease.

Qais bin Al-Khatim said:
When we descended Al-Harth, our prince said / Wine is forbidden to us as long as we do not fight.
Mighty men among us permitted it / So they did not return until it was lawful for a drinker.

Zaid Al-Khail said:
Salama knew that my sword / Is hateful whenever 'Get down' is called.
I talk to it with polishing every day / And I test it on the heads of men.

Sawwar bin Hayyan Al-Munqari said:
We urged Al-Hawfazan with a stab / That gave him purple blood of the hollow to drink.
God decreed that on the day we divide the heights / We are more worthy of them than you, and He gave and was generous.
You are not capable of the sky, and you did not find / For the might God built above you, a heavy burden.

Zaid bin Amr bin Qais said:
I was such that if I knocked on a king's door / I knocked with fathers of huge lineage.
They possessed the properties of the family of Muharriq / And increased Abu Qabus spite upon spite.
We were such that if we shot at the rocks of a people / We left cracks in the rock we shot.
We graze the sanctuary of enemies without it being forbidden / And our sanctuary which we protect is not grazed.

Al-Qallah bin Zaid, one of Banu Amr bin Malik, said:
His wife incites Zaid, so he obeys her / Against me, and to the slanderer he is more cheating and lying.
If a day came when bravery dries up the saliva / She would fight for you against the people while dyeing (her hands).
A drawer (of women) and an incense burner are not equal, O Zaid / To the chest of a spear tested in wars.

Mu'abbin Al-Lajlaj said:
Did you not see that evil, what excites it / Is its small parts, until it completes and grows big.
Indeed, the latent mange, its remedy is hidden / From its people until it becomes clear and appears.

Al-Mufaddal bin Al-Muhallab said:
Is generosity anything but being generous with souls / On every sharp two-edged sword?
Whoever shakes the tips of spears for fear of death / Is not a gainer of righteous glory.

Anas bin Mudrik said:
How many a noble brother of mine I was stricken with / Then I remained as if I were a stone after him.
I do not submit to the doubt of time, nor / Do I grieve over the matter that fate comes before.
A thrower of wars, I circulate the matter / When some of them are slaughtered for matters that befall.
Verily, my hobbling of Sulayk after his killing / Is like the bull being beaten when the cows refuse (to drink).

Wa'la bin Al-Harith Al-Jarmi said:
When we met in the distance, our greeting became / The blue of the straightened spears.
Withered, on their tips are Qa'dabiyya (swords) / Thin in their sides, quenched with blood.

Hatim Al-Tai said:
And horses calling for stabbing, I witnessed them / And if I were not among them, their excuse would be bad.
And a flood of death with no leniency / The chests of sharp swords are its bridges.
A Tha'labi family refuses my oppression / Its rich is noble, its poor is chaste.
I swore I would not give kings a grievance / While around me are Adi, its old and young.

Al-Farazdaq said:
You gifted Ma'add on the day of Kisra bin Hormuz / With a decisive blow that straightened every leaner.
At the valley of Dhu Qar, the morning there came to you / Bombs of death guided by bombs.
You exceeded Banu Shayban in favor and sovereignty / Just as Shayban exceeded Bakr bin Wa'il.

Al-Abbas bin Abdul Muttalib said:
Our people refused to treat us fairly, so fair / Cutting swords in our right hands dripping blood (treated them).
We left them not permitting afterwards / A sanctuary for any relative among the rest of people.
We restrained them, the restraint of the Hums in the morning / With every Surayji sword, deaf when shaken.

O Abu Talib, do not accept the half (compromise) from them / Even if they are fair, until they disobey and are unjust.

Abu Talib said:
By God's life, if the seriousness of what I see / Is for our swords to be confused with the distinguished ones.
By the hand of a youth like a meteor, noble / Trustworthy, protector of the reality, brave.
Until you see the wounded riding his wound / From stabbing, the action of the deviating bearer.

A'sha Bahila said:
Bombs from Qahtan, the like of whom was not seen / If the crack burdened the opinion of every repairer.
When we saw them, we advanced to their gathering / With a trailing, massive army, great of shoulders.
Their skins were pierced by the tips of spears / Between killed and fleeing.

Abu Al-Aswad Al-Du'ali said:
Convey a message from me to Ziyad / Trotting to him wherever he is on earth.
What is wrong with you, looking grim when you meet me / Cutting the glance of your eyes away from me like one closing his eyes?
What is wrong with me, when love wears out between us / I twist the strands of it and you work on undoing?
Did you not see that I do not color my mark / The coloring of the ghoul of the night in the desolate land?
But I throw the enemy with a calamity / The earth splits from it in length and width.

Khut bin Sulma said:
There is no people like my people when rises / The meteor of war kindled by spears.
There is no people like my people when feared / For the secluded maiden, the scandal.
I defend the sanctities in Ma'add / When the struggle becomes serious with the people.
We were patient breaking the spearheads in them / So we went appearing victorious over them, and they went.

Ibn Mayada said:
His hands: a hand pouring with good and dew / And another severe, harming the enemies.
And his fires: a fire, the fire of every defender / And another, its blaze hits the criminals.

Nasr bin Sayyar Al-Kinani said:
By my soul, on the morning of fear, the knights of Khindif / And the knights of Qais, their impact and patience.
When Qais and Khindif strut with spears / At their neighbor, their neighbor does not fear oppression.

Another said:
When I saw our prince frowning / I bade farewell to the courtyard of his house with peace.
I found my fathers who preceded / Launched refusal against kings before me.

Another said:
I ran as the noble accustomed me / And the noble run according to their habits.
Thus the precedents do not stop / When sent towards their goals.

A man from Qais said:
We are the owners of people by force / We drive them to humiliation and punishment.
We trod on Al-Ash'ari with the might of Qais / What a treading that will not be revoked.
And he became... among us a prisoner... / Did they not prevent him if they were men?
Their great one and master of old / We made disgraces shades for him.

Bakr bin Al-Nattah said:
He meets the dew with a shy face / And the chests of spears with a bold face.
Thus, thus are the heights / The paths of seriousness are not the paths of joking.

Another said:
A people who, when the spears differ / Make chests paths for them.
They wore hearts over armor / Demonstrating to repel that.

Al-Farazdaq said:
Our dreams (minds) are weighed against mountains / And our ignorant one exceeds the ignorant.
We descend the gap of every feared place / With noble horses like ghouls.

Tufayl bin Amr bin Hamama said:
Shall I surrender on humiliation while I am not immortal / And I have no protector if my decree comes?
So no peace until the people are urged a distinct urge / And birds become pressing on my flesh.
And until there is a day, bright, marked / The riders travel with it, of huge news.

Harb bin Umayyah said to Ibn Abi Bara regarding the War of Fijar:
Whenever you visit us, you find our war / Trained, its fire shining.
And a people upon whom are ample armors / Horses whose helmets shine.
Lamps like the stars of the sky / And what God raises is not lowered.

Ibn Al-Mawla said:
If a flash is imagined from your cloud / Its imagery precedes the hand of the rain-seeker.
And if you do a favor, you complete it / With two hands whose dew is not turbid.
And if the knights count their heroes / They count you in their first with the little finger.

Al-Nabigha Al-Ja'di said:
We are a people, our horses are not accustomed / When we meet, to deviate and flee.
We deny on the day of fear the colors of our horses / From stabbing, until you think the dark one is blond.
It is not known to us to return them / Sound, nor disapproved that they be dusted.

Another said:
If our rulers and governors are unjust / We litigate them with sharp swords.

Swords as if death allied with their edge / Striped, glued to the sutures of skulls.
When we draw them for a day of hate / We strike with them what held onto the hilts (or legs).

Abu Sufyan bin Al-Harith said:
We arrived at the belly of Sal' against you / With our swords, and the horses bleeding their throats.
We left the Khazraji prostrate / The exhalation of his soul spitting out life.
We left him when our spears left him / With nothing remaining but an eye he turns.

Malik bin Awf Al-Nasri said:
When my colt complained to me of pain / At the exchange of stabbing, I said to him: Advance.
I am with my soul in wars a trader / That trade has no cash of Dirhams.

Sa'd bin Nashib Al-Mazini said:
Our swords are white, Indian / Old, and your marks on your heads are new.
If we draw them one day, having returned / The heads of Banu Bakr are supports for them.

Musa bin Jabir Al-Hanafi said:
We are standers at the position which / Its destruction is feared and souls look up.
We give the Mashrafi swords their right / So they cut in our right hands and sever.

Ka'b bin Malik said:
We are people who do not see killing as a disgrace / For anyone who protects the honor and benefits.
Sturdy against the uncertainty of events, you do not see / An eye of ours weeping for a dead one ever.

Another said:
My companion wept when he saw death above us / Looming like the shadows of clouds when they darken.
So I said to him: Let not your eye weep, for / Tomorrow there will be good praise for him who is patient.
So console yourself for a state where sorrow is little / And fight until the arrival and return become vague.

Malik bin Al-Rayb said:
The compassionate ones say to me: Until / When will you meet armies without an army?
Whoever has a sword and a spear / And is pleased with death himself, is singly (an army).

Mutahhar bin Riyah bin Amr said:
To God belongs the goodness of Banu Riyah / In great calamities.
They protect the women, for they are / The shackles of the noble against fleeing.

Ibn Suraym Al-Jarmi said:
I return the battalion defeated / While it left honors for me.
I am not, when I am on a side / An eater of the clan, backbiting it.
But I obey its masters / And I do not learn its nicknames (insults).

Al-Qatari bin Al-Fuja'a said:
Many sharp ones, active to the battle / Swift to the caller, noble of fronts.
I made them wade the sea of death, and I waded it / Hoping for reward, not hoping for spoils.

Muslim bin Al-Walid said:
If a people were created as death / From their might, they would be the sons of Gabriel.
A people who, when the noon turns red from battle / Make skulls a resting place for swords.

Jumal said:
Banu Ja'far, no peace until we visit you / With every Rudayni spear and white marked sword.
And until you see amidst the houses a raid / Enclosing you with striking, ignoring the ruggedness.
Clear to the doubter who did not know / The blind sees it and the deaf hears.

Al-Nabigha Al-Dhubyani said:
I fear for you that you will have / Because of their hatred, a day like the days (of old).
They have a banner in the hands of a noble hero / The rag (distance) is not cut except his eye is aiming.
Carrying rings of smooth armor, led by / High-nosed ones, strikers of heads.
Do not scold a frowning one having no equal / Like the night mixing darkness with darkness.
The horses know that we in their argument / On the day of preservation represent misery and favor.
Wolves run against him who has no dogs / And avoid the leap of the alert protector.

Zaid Al-Khail said:
Banu Amir, what will you do when attacks / Abu Miknaf, having tightened the knot of the roots?
With an army in whose sides the piebald horses get lost / You see the hills in it prostrate to the hooves.
And a gathering like the night, thundering in battle / Many its followers, fast its initiatives.

Amir Al-Khasafi Al-Muharibi said:
O inquirer, you did not ask me / About our days in war except to know.
We have the unyielding might, we muzzle the enemies / With it, then it resists being muzzled.
People cannot undo a knot we tied / And we undo theirs even if it is tight.
Our fathers left us from their heritage / Pillars of glory that were marked among people.
They stabilize the earth; were it not for them, it would shake / With those on it, articulate and mute.
Our speaker stands and does not falter in speech / When distress makes the coward forget what he learned.
We were stars; whenever a star fell / A shining one appeared from them, not dark.

Abu Tammam said:
The sword is more truthful in news than books / In its edge is the limit between seriousness and play.
White of blades, not black of pages, in / Their texts is the clearing of doubt and suspicion.
Knowledge is in the sparks of spears shining / Between the two armies, not in the seven stars.
