For Ka'b bin Zuhair:
If I were to wonder at something, I would be pleased by / The striving of the youth while fate is hidden for him.
The youth strives for matters he attains / While the soul is one and the concern is scattered.
Man, as long as he lives, hope is extended for him / The eye does not end until the trace ends.

Another said:
Be patient with the pain of night travel in the dawn / And in the going for needs and the early morning.
Do not be bored nor let incapacity enter you / For success perishes between incapacity and boredom.
I saw, and in days is experience / For patience is a consequence of praised effect.
Rarely did one strive in a matter he seeks / And accompanied patience, but he won the victory.

For Ka'b bin Zuhair:
I know that whenever my decree befalls me / Neither stinginess nor pity holds it back.
While the youth is impressed by life, envied / Suddenly the youth is surrendered to deaths, locked.
The man of wealth increases, then it is taken away / By the passing of ages, and it annihilates him so he is crushed.
Likewise man, if his term is delayed / A layer after a layer rides him.

Abdullah bin Ja'far bin Abi Talib said:
I do not fear the poverty of lack / What... God in generosity.
Whenever I spend, He replaces it for me / My Lord, the Vast in blessings.

Hassan said:
Indeed a man who spends the evening and morning safe / From people except for what he committed is happy.
And a man who attained richness then did not give / To a relative or a needy one is miserable (or ascetic in good).
And a man who antagonized men over richness / And did not ask God for richness is envious.

Al-Mutalammis said:
Whoever has an upper arm (support) attains his grievance / Indeed, the humiliated is the one who has no upper arm.
No one stays on oppression imposed on him / Except the two humiliated ones: the donkey of the tribe and the peg.
This one is tied by his rope on humiliation / And that one is smashed, so no one pities him.

Al-Namir bin Tawlab said:
If one fears death / It will befriend him wherever he is.
And if its causes miss you / Your end is to become decrepit.
So love your beloved a gentle love / For it will not burden you if you cut off.
And hate your hated one a gentle hate / If you tried to judge.
If anyone were saved from his death / You would have found the protected mountain goat (saved).

For Dabi' bin Al-Harith Al-Barjami:
Hasty birds do not bring the youth near / To guidance, nor does he fail from their slowness.
There is no good in one who does not settle himself / On the calamities of time when they befall.
In doubt is negligence, and in prudence is strength / And the youth errs in guessing and hits.

For Ka'b bin Sa'd Al-Ghanawi:
Did you not know that my sitting does not delay my death / Nor does my departure bring death closer?
Whoever does not attain until he blocks his gaps / Finds the desires of the soul not few.
I am not, for the thing that does not benefit me / And angers my companion, a sayer.

For Suwayd bin Al-Samit:
How many a one you call a friend, and if you saw / His saying in absence, what he fabricates would grieve you.
His saying is like honeycomb when he is present / And in absence, it is transmitted on the gap of the throat (backbiting).
The two eyes clarify to you what the chest conceals / Of hatred and malice by the sidelong glance.
Feather me with good as long as you have trimmed me / The best of clients is he who feathers (helps) and does not trim (harm).

For Uhayhah bin Al-Jalah Al-Awsi:
The poor does not know when is his richness / Nor does the rich know when he becomes destitute.
You do not know, even if you resolved a matter / In which land the resting place overtakes you.
You do not know, even if you strike a she-camel (for mating) / Will she conceive after that or fail?
You do not know, even if you produce a foal / Is the weaned camel for another or will it be yours?

For a Bedouin:
If the beginning of every matter is wasted / Its ends refuse anything but twisting.
If you assign your matter to every scoundrel / Weak, your matter will be equal.
If you treat a debt with forgetting / And with leniency, you missed the cure.

For Al-Mutalammis:
He disobeyed me so he did not find guidance, and indeed / The consequences of the matter of the misguided become clear.
So do not cover it, they will rise above it / How do you protect the back of him whom you are riding?
I hated you, so hate me, no connection between us / Likewise, he who dispenses, his companion dispenses.

For Al-Asma'i:
Do not cut off a brother of yours at a sin / For the sin is forgiven by the noble.

Do not hasten against anyone with injustice / For the grazing of injustice is unwholesome.
Gentleness in what is said is a blessing / And clumsiness in things is an ill omen.
Do not be obscene even if you are filled with rage / Against anyone, for obscenity is baseness.
The best connection is what you perpetuate of it / And the worst connection is a connection that does not last.
Indeed, if you strive, you will not meet / A trustworthy brother... his skin is sound.

For Hamid bin Thaur:
I see my sight has disturbed me after health / And it is enough of a disease for you that you are healthy and safe.
And that the two eras, day and night, wait / If they seek to catch what they intended.

For Al-Mutawakkil Al-Laythi:
I was such that if the friend wanted to cut me off / I turned the back of the shield to his cutting.
I am never trusting a friend / With anything if he does not trust me.

For another:
The hand of favor is a gain wherever it is / An ungrateful or a grateful one bears it.
With the grateful ones, it has a reward / And with God is what the ungrateful denied.

For another:
She said: You benefit and do not become rich. I said to her: / Is richness other than what I spent seeking reward?
How many a worldly brother we saw marching with it / Nothing remained of him and it except what he gave.

For Al-Harith bin Namir Al-Tanukhi:
Everyone has a nature in what he seeks / And the preference between men is natures.
Days may turn the states of their people / And foxes attack the lions of men.

For Shabib bin Uqba:
Neither the blocking of the veil nor might and guards / Repel deaths from their locations.
The two new ones (night and day), in the length of their difference / Do not decrease, but people decrease.
Do not destroy the soul in extravagance over greed / Greed is poverty and richness is despair.

For a Bedouin:
Youth and gray hair, their habit is / To decrease you by undoing or by twisting (tightening).
Gray hair does not depart from a house it settles in / Until the owner of the house departs from it.

Abu Al-Sha'r Musa bin Suhaym Al-Dabbi said:
While the shade is shady, pleasing / The sun rose upon it and it vanished.
Wealth went like the shadow folded / After there was a shading place in it.
While luck is happy, approaching / Suddenly it persists in stumbling and slipping.
If a man's luck turns away / The possessor of turning luck tastes the humiliation of life.
He is deprived of good when he seeks it / And when he fears evil, it descends.
A people who committed crimes will not attain excuse / Then said: The sword preceded the blame.

Sakhr bin Amr said:
By my life, I alerted him who was sleeping / And made hear him who had two ears.
I intend the matter of prudence if I can do it / But a barrier was placed between the wild ass and the leaping.
There is no good in a life that is like / The place of a dragonfly on the head of a spear.

For another:
Whoever praises the world for a life that pleases him / Will, by my life, blame it after a while.
If it turns back, it is a regret for the man / And if it approaches, its worries are many.

Jarir said:
I am chaste in poverty, sharing in richness / Swift to move if I am not pleased with my house.
My sword has no remnant in the bones / And the sword has a less severe impact than my tongue.

Bal'aa bin Qais said:
I entertain worry until it guests me / For a time, when the sources of worry are weary.
I seek the correctness of thought, knowing that / If a man's thought misses, his decrees miss.
Man may hate what contains his guidance / And his guidances are found in other than what is correct.

Al-Khatfi, grandfather of Jarir, said:
I wondered at the incompetence of the incompetent with himself / And the silence of him who was more knowledgeable in speech.
In silence is a cover for the incompetent, and indeed / The page of a man's core is that he speaks.

For another:
When you see a man led by passion / Then his bereaving mothers have bereaved him at that time.
He made enemies rejoice out of ignorance of himself / And his blamers found a say in him.
Nothing restrains the stubborn soul from passion / Among people except the one of superior, complete intellect.

For a Bedouin from Banu Asad:
They say: Invest what you can, but / What the earner invested of wealth belongs to his heir.
So eat it, feed it, and snatch it from an heir / Stingy, and time which calamities befall.

Al-Harith bin Kalda said:
Among people is he whose benefit covers the distant / And his relatives are miserable with him until death.
If there is good in you, the distant attains it / And if there is evil, your cousin is its companion.

For Hassan bin Ghadir:
For what time does a man hide himself? / Tomorrow is tomorrow, and death comes and goes.
If a man does not benefit you while alive, his benefit / Is less when the stones are stacked upon him.

Death has assaults by which powers are undone / And stingy souls forget wealth.

For Bishr bin Suleiman:
I have not seen like good that a man leaves / Nor evil that a man comes to while obedient.
Nor like the fear of God as a remaining good / And better in voice when a listener hears.
Nor like desires, not returning a benefit ever / If the youth were content with the truth instead of them.
Nor like a man going in the affair of another / To distract him from his affair while it is lost.

For Shabib bin Al-Barsaa:
Truth has a share in my money when it guests me / And the dispersed soul has a share.
There is no good in one who does not settle himself / On the calamities of time when they befall.

For another:
Whoever goes abroad knows the place of his friend / And whoever raids does not lack a trial from time.
I did not see a possessor of hardship last, nor richness / And richness is nothing but close to poverty.
If what I did is a shame, then perhaps / The day of evil came to a man from where he did not know.

For Dhawad bin Al-Raqraq:
Love is only with him who is worthy of it / And evil is only with him who carries it.
In time and experience is a deterrent for a man / And in death is an occupation for the youth that occupies him.

For Imran bin Hittan:
Man regrets what he missed / Of desires if he did not fulfill them.
And we see him happy, rejoicing / At what he fulfilled, as if he did not fulfill it.
Wonder at the soul's joy with it / After it has gone out of its grasp.
In my view, they and the dreams of sleep / Are close, some to others.

For another:
I am a visitor to him who does not visit me / If he is not suspicious in his love.
I seek nearness to the house of the beloved even if far / And the house of him whom I hated is not near.

Judge Abu Al-Hasan Ali bin Abdul Aziz Al-Jurjani said:
I ceased not being biased with my honor to a side / Away from humiliation, counting preservation as a spoil.
If it is said 'This is a watering place', I said: I see / But the soul of the free man bears thirst.
I restrain it from some of what does not shame it / Fearing the sayings of enemies 'Why or For what'.
So I become safe from the blame of the mean / And I went honored in the soul of the noble.
They say to me 'There is withdrawal in you', but / They saw a man who refrained from the position of humiliation.
I see people, whoever approaches them becomes base to them / And whoever the pride of soul honors, is honored.
I did not fulfill the right of knowledge if whenever / Greed appeared, I made it a ladder for myself.
I did not degrade my soul in the service of knowledge / To serve whom I met, but to be served.
Shall I suffer planting it and harvest it as humiliation? / Then following ignorance would have been more prudent.
If the people of knowledge protected it, it would protect them / And if they magnified it in souls, it would be magnified.
But they humiliated it, so they were humiliated and soiled / Its face with greed until it frowned.
I, when a matter misses me, do not spend the night / Turning my palm on its trace, regretting.
But if it comes effortlessly, I accept it / And if it leans away, I do not follow it with 'Halla' and 'Laytama' (wishes).
I restrict my step from many lucks / If I do not attain them with ample honor, honored.
I honor myself from laughing with a frowning one / And from receiving a blameworthy one with praise.
How many a seeker of elevation by his favor did not reach / It, even if he was the honored chief.
Not every lightning that appeared to me provokes me / Nor is everyone on earth whom I accept as a benefactor.
But when the matter compels me, I cease not / Turning my thought, helping then accusing.
Until I see him whom I do not choke on mentioning / If I said 'He did a favor to me and blessed'.
How many a blessing was a curse on the free man / And how many a spoil the free man counts as a fine.

Abu Tammam said:
If God wants to publish a virtue / That was folded, He makes available for it the tongue of an envious one.
Were it not for the burning of fire in what it neighbored / The good scent of the oud would not be known.
Were it not for fear of consequences / Favor would remain for the envier against the envied.

He also said:
The length of a man's stay in the tribe wears out / His two brocades (cheeks/dignity), so travel abroad, you will be renewed.
For I saw the sun increased in love / To people because it is not permanent over them.

He also said:
Do not hold me accountable for time, for it is not / A follower to me, and I am not a guarantor for time.
Whoever fights the days, then prepares for them / Other than contentment, ceases not to be defeated.
Whoever's grazing ground for his resolve and concerns / Is the grazing ground of wishes, ceases not to be emaciated.
If the authority of contentment and its rule were unjust / In creation, the little would not be little.

Provision, do not grieve over it, for / It comes, and you did not send a messenger to it.

He also said:
The youth attains from his life while he is ignorant / And the youth fails in his time while he is knowledgeable.
If shares ran according to intelligence / Then the beasts would have perished from their ignorance.
May God reward a hand full of happiness / That circulated in the destruction of wealth while wealth slept.
East and west never gathered for an intender / Nor glory in the hand of a man and Dirhams.
I have not seen like kindness, whose rights are called / Debts among people, while they are spoils.
Nor like height, as long as poetry does not see among it / Is like the earth, unmarked, having no landmarks.

He also said:
The possessor of love from me and the possessor of kinship are in one station / And my brothers are equal to me and my friends.
A band whose manners neighbored my manners / So they, even if separated in the land, are my neighbors.
Our souls are in one place, while / Our bodies are in Sham or Khurasan.
Many a one distant in dwellings, his soul is forever / Attached to my soul, and a near one is not near.

He also said:
A man's face does not whiten in seeking height / Until a face blackens in the deserts.
You spoke truth, indeed provision seeks its people / But by the trick of a tired, weary one.

He also said:
There is no good in kinship without affection / And perhaps one benefits from the friendship of distant ones.
If kinship approaches with affection / Tighten the palm of acceptance for it with an arm.

Al-Buhturi said:
I forbade you from exposing the honor of a free man / For blame is the business of the blameworthy.
The clumsiness of the fool, even if he transgresses / Is not more effective in you than the hatred of the noble.
When you embarrass a possessor of generosity, he steps / Towards you with some morals of the mean.

Al-Mutanabbi said:
If a friend, I denied his side / Tricks did not weary me in separating from him.
In the width of the two horizons is a place to move / And in lands is a substitute for their sister.

He also said:
If favor does not raise you from thanking a deficient one / For a gift, then favor is in him who has the thanks.
Whoever spends hours gathering his money / Fearing poverty, then what he did is poverty.
I saw harm as better in appearance / And easier than the sight of a small one acting big.

He also said:
The most tired of God's creation is he whose ambition increased / And his capacity fell short of what the soul desires.
Let not all your money be dissolved in glory / So a glory whose knot was by money dissolves.
Manage it the management of a possessor of glory for his palm / When he fights enemies and wealth is his fire-striker.
For there is no glory in the world for him whose money is little / And no money in the world for him whose glory is little.

For another:
The seeker of needs from those he seeks / Among people is none other than the persisting patient one.
If he attains success, his arrow won by patience / Otherwise, it is despair, and it is an excuser for the soul.

Abu Nuwas said:
The seeker of needs from those he seeks / Among people is none other than those waking up on a leg.
For the promises of the noble, perhaps / Persistence carried a generous one to stinginess.

He also said:
And one enslaving his brothers with his wealth / I wore pride for him exceeding pride.
If a gathering joined me and him one day / He saw my side rugged, exceeding ruggedness.
It increased my arrogance over people that I / See myself as their richest, even if I am of poverty.
By God, no... to my tongue for a need / To anyone until I disappear in the grave.
Let no commoner hope for that from me / Nor the king of the world veiled in the palace.

Abu Al-Fath Al-Busti said:
O you who rival heights effortlessly without fatigue / Far from it! Attaining heights effortlessly without fatigue.
Stick to hard work; I have not found anyone / Who contained the share of heights without toil.

He also said:
Avoid the enmity of men, for it / Is a turbidness for the clarity of every watering place.
Do not stir up a war, even if you are confident / In the strength of a pillar or the power of a shoulder.
For the possessor of mind will not drink instant poison / Relying on an antidote he has tested.

He also said:
If you wean a man from a habit that became old / Make for him, O bond of virtue, a graduation.
Do not be violent if you straighten a crooked one / For perhaps straightening results in crookedness.

He also said:
O commander of me to acquire wealth, striving / So that I may live for my wealth tomorrow in comfort.
Grant me that by my effort I fixed the matter of tomorrow / Who guarantees for me the acquisition of life tomorrow?

He also said:
If you love to live / With preserved status and value.

And to be safe among people / From treachery and plotting.
Then do not be greedy for abundance / And do not covet a front seat.
And increase the saying of 'I don't know' / Even if you are a man who knows.

Also by him:
Knowledge is the most precious item you store / Whoever studies knowledge, his prides do not fade.
Strive to know what you are ignorant of / For the beginning of knowledge is approach and its end is...

Also by him:
If you serve kings, then wear / From caution the most invincible dress.
Enter upon them while you are blind / And leave, when you leave, dumb.

Also by him:
Beware your friend if he changes, for he / Is a harm hitting the free man when he opposes.
Like wine, its taste and breeze are prevented / But if it turns, it is sour vinegar.

He also said:
Be content with sufficiency, for it is more worthy / Of the face of the free man than the humiliation of submission.
Be stingy with the water of your face, do not spill it / And do not give it to the withholding scoundrel.
For easier than the asking of the free man for a gift / Is the death of the free man from hunger and variety (of pain).

He also said:
Do not deprive a noble man as much as you can, nor / Affirm success for a mean person whose nature is stamped.
For the noble, if hunger touches them / Attack the attack of the mean people if they are full.

He also said:
If a people served the Sultan to be honored / By him and attain all they look forward to.
I served my God and held fast to His rope / That He may protect me from the evil of what I fear.
And honor me with knowledge, forbearance, and piety / And give me what does not perish and destroy.
So serving Him who gives Sultans their kingdom / And strips it from them is greater and more noble.

He also said:
If you are seeking the rank of the noble / Then upon you is kindness and fairness.
If a friend transgresses against you, leave him / And time, for it is a sufficient repaying for him.

He also said:
I advised you, do not accompany anyone but every virtuous one / Of worthy traits, with chastity and wit.
Do not rely on other than the noble, for one / Of the people, if you count, is better than a thousand.
Pity this time and pass it / For the time of a man is more crooked than a perverse one.

He also said:
If you rise to the high deeds, draw / A determination like the determination of strong men.
If you are pleased with the base as a home / Then the earth, where you settled it, is a home for you.

He also said:
Whoever wants an easy life to benefit by / In his religion, then prosperity in his world.
Let him look at who is above him in manners / And let him look at who is below him in condition.

He also said:
Ask God for a beneficial mind and seek refuge in Him / From ignorance; you ask the Best Giver for a seeker.
For by the mind you fulfill all virtues / Just as ignorance fulfills all vices.

He also said:
The condition of farming is planting plants / And the condition of leadership is planting men.
If you do not associate with anyone but a perfect one / You will remain alone, due to the scarcity of perfection.

He also said:
Do not despise a man if you see in him / Ugliness or shabbiness of clothes.
For the bee is a thing, despite its smallness / The youth gathers honey harvest from it.

He also said:
If you wish to meet your enemy humiliated / Burning him with sadness and killing him with grief.
Then seek heights and increase in virtue, for / Whoever increases in virtue, his enviers increase in worry.

He also said:
Leave me and my mark in chastity, for I / Made my chastity my habit in my life.
Greater than cutting the two hands for a youth / Is the loss of a kindness he attained from the hands of a low person.

For another:
I killed my ambitions and rested my soul / Because the soul, as long as it covets, is humiliated.
I revived contentment, and it was dead / And in its revival my honor is preserved.
If greed settles in the heart of a slave / Humiliation rises over him and disgrace rises over him.

Abu Firas said:
Other than me, the rough treatment changes him / And he turns from the traits of the fulfilling noble.
I am not pleased with a love if it does not last / During roughness and lack of fairness.
Miserable is the greedy, and rarely does he bring / A compensation for persistence and begging.
The rich is the rich in himself / Even if he is bare of shoulders, barefoot.
Not everything on the earth is sufficient / But if you are content, everything is sufficient.
My manliness, my chivalry, my contentment, and my chastity / Refuse the greed of the greedy for me.

He also said:
I have not been, since I was, anything but obedient to my friends / Blaming loved ones is not my habit.
If my friend does not increase his bad deed / Then where is the place of my kindness and forgiveness?

He commits a crime against me and I bend forgivingly forever / Nothing is better than a bending one over a criminal.

He also said:
Spend from beautiful patience, for / A spender from his patience does not fear poverty.
Be forbearing even if the sitter acts foolishly, and say to him / Good speech even if he came to you with obscenity.
Man does not reach in his land / Like the hawk is not a hunter in his nest.

He also said:
They say: Do not tear prestige with your forbearance / And the best thing... is forbearance.
So do not leave blame for every sinner / For pardon is not blameworthy even if the offense is great.

He also said:
If you pass by a valley whose wave heaved / Tie your young she-camel and alight, that is our valley.
And if you cross a valley which / The people of foolishness do not frequent, sit, that is our club.
The guest becomes the most entitled of us to our home / We are pleased with that, and his rule passes among us.

He also said:
They returned listening to us, so we returned / To the customary honor of deeds.
Whenever we are pleased after anger / We heal what we wounded with gifts.

Al-Sari Al-Raffa said:
O blamer, indeed calamities are lying in wait / And the joy of man is not eternal.
Whenever a good day of life passes / Connect it with a good day of life, comfortable.

For Judge Ibn Ma'ruf:
Beware your enemy once / And beware your friend a thousand times.
For perhaps the friend turns / And becomes more knowing of the harm.

For Abu Muhammad bin Al-Munajjim:
If you do not attain the ambitions of the noble / And their striving while resting, then go abroad.
How many a comfort tired its people / And how many a rest resulted from fatigue.

For Abu Al-Faraj bin Hindu:
Let not a glory whose distance is far repel you / For glory has graduation and arrangement.
Indeed the spear whose height you witnessed / Grows and ascends knot by knot.

For Al-Sahib bin Abbad:
If a Sultan brings you near, increase / In respect for him, accompany him, and watch.
For the Sultan is nothing but the sea in greatness / And being near the sea has feared consequences.

For Abu Al-Nasr Al-Abiwardi:
It pleases the youth that his blame spreads / So he handles it with preservation and concealment.
Be cautious about the secret by hiding it / For walls have ears.

For Abu Bakr Al-Khwarizmi:
Do not accompany the lazy in his needs / How many a righteous one is corrupted by the corruption of another.
The infection of the dull to the dull is swift / And the coal is placed in the ash and extinguishes.

For Abu Al-Fath Al-Busti:
Do not despise a brother even if you saw him / Rough to you and negating what you love.
For the branch withers then becomes fresh / And water becomes turbid then returns clear.

He also said:
You must show endurance to the enemies / And let not withering appear from you so you are despised.
Do you not see the basil is smelled when fresh / And thrown in the toilet when it changes?

He also said:
Remind your brother if he forgets a duty / Or a shortcoming appears in his opinions.
For opinion rusts like the sword due to an obstruction / That occurs to it, and its polishing is reminding.

He also said:
Avoid conflict if you permitted a promise / To be safe from the satire of people and be healed.
For if the willow bore fruit after its blossom / And its leafing, they would not have nicknamed it 'Khilaf' (Conflict/Willow).

He also said:
Whenever you choose a man, let him be / Of noble lineage, pure of ancestry.
For the base of men is like the base of plants / Neither for fruits nor for firewood.

He also said:
Let not the youth take his enemy lightly / Ever, even if the enemy is small.
For the mote hurts the eyes, its little / And perhaps the mosquito wounded the elephant.

For Abu Suleiman Ahmad Al-Khattabi:
As long as you are alive, treat all people kindly / For you are in the house of kindness (or simulation).
Whoever knows, knows; and whoever does not know will see / After a short while, a companion to regrets.

For Judge Al-Tanukhi:
Take the penny from the palm of the mean, for it / Is dearer to him than the last breath of his soul.
And... as long as you live from every low person / For he has no value the amount of his penny.

He countered him with his saying:
Protect the soul from the humiliation of asking and its bad luck / The best condition of the youth is protecting his soul.
Do not expose yourself to the mean, for / The free man is more humiliated to him than half his penny.

Abu Al-Fadl said:
Do not prevent the surplus of money you were gifted / For giving grows it, after the reward is stored.
Generosity is taken from its sides hoping / That eating and fruit from it will be doubled.

He also said:
Leave greed and be content with sufficiency of richness / For the provision of the youth as long as he lives is at his livelihood.

Abundance of wealth may destroy man / Just as the peacock is slaughtered for its feathers.

He also said:
The life of a youth is his mention, not the length of his duration / And his death is his shame, not his near death.
So revive your mention with kindness you distribute / Two lives are gathered for you in the world by it.

Abu Al-Nasr said:
Avoid the evil ones of people and accompany their good ones / To imitate them in the bulk of their actions.
For the morals of men and their action / Have an infection to others that comes to them running.

Al-Buhturi said:
I was content and avoided ambitions, wearing / The dress of a lover of asceticism, preferring.
My knowledge comforted me that my advancing / Does not benefit me, nor does my delay harm a luck.
If the destined missed me of what I seek / By striving, I attained what was not destined.

He also said:
Lighten the worries upon yourself, for / He enjoys the rest of his time who lightens.
Reject the base ambitions, for they are / A disgrace that attaches, and their right is to be rejected.
Praise is the most precious thing a man is compensated with / Who is stricken in inheritance, if the stricken is compensated.

Abu Al-Tayyib Al-Mutanabbi said:
Sons of our father, we are the people of stopping places / Forever the crow of separation croaks among us.
We weep over the world, and there is no group / The world gathered them but they separated.
Where are the Chosroes, the tyrants, those who / Hoarded treasures? Neither they remained nor the treasures.
From everyone whom space narrowed with his army / Until he stayed, so a narrow grave contained him.
Death is coming and souls are precious / And the deceived by what he has is the fool.
Man hopes while life is appetizing / Old age is more dignified and youth is more reckless.
I wept over youth while my side hair / Was black and my face had luster.
Fearing for it before the day of its separation / Until I almost choked on the water of my eyelid.

He also said:
This house (world) is more treacherous than a prostitute / And more deceptive than the trap of the snarer.
Men perished for the love of her / And they do not obtain anything worthwhile.

He also said:
Where is he whose building is the two pyramids? / What is his people, what is his day, what is the falling place?
Traces remain behind their owners / For a while, then annihilation overtakes them and they follow.

Abu Nuwas said:
We walked of the world every path / So two days: a day of space and a strait.
If a wise man tested the world, it revealed / To him an enemy in the clothes of a friend.

Abu Al-Fath Al-Busti said:
Every ascent leads to a descent / Every brisk market to stagnation.
How can the goodness of a state be hoped / In the world of generation and corruption?

He also said:
O you who boast of the world and its decoration / Be wary of the changes of its nights.
Let not a life deceive you even if it is clear and effaced / For man is in deception from the deceits of days.
Time, as you tested its nature / Is dividing the matter between clarity and turbidity.

Abu Nuwas said:
By your life, sights do not benefit their people / If the seers do not have insights.
Does the linear spear benefit unless straightened / And do gems appear except by polishing?
How is glory attained while the body is resting / And how is praise gathered while wealth is abundant?

He also said:
If God does not help you in what He wants / No creature has a way to it.
If He does not guide you in every path / You perish even if Spica (star) is a guide.

Abu Muhammad Al-Khwarizmi said:
I wondered at one impressed by his image / While he was before a emitted drop.
And tomorrow, after the beauty of his image / He becomes in the earth a dirty carcass.
While he is in his vanity and arrogance / Between his two garments he carries excrement.

For Dhu Al-Kifayatayn:
People entered the world before us / They departed from it and left it for us.
We settled it as they had settled / And we leave it to a people after us.

For another:
The youth deserves pardon if he confesses / What he committed and desists from what he perpetrated.
For His saying: Say to those who disbelieved, if they desist / What has passed will be forgiven for them.

For Abu Al-Fath Al-Busti:
If a king starts the day busy with amusement / Then judge upon his kingdom with woe and war.
Do you not see the sun descending in Libra / When the sign of the star of amusement and mirth rises?

For Abu Ahmad Al-Katib:
Do good when time is good / And the guarantee from it is valid for you.
Hasten with your kindness to the nights / For there is no safety from their treachery.

Al-Mutanabbi said:
How many a faulter of a correct saying / While his bane is from the sick understanding.
But ears take from it / According to the capacity of minds and sciences.

He also said:
The possessor of intellect suffers in bliss with his intellect / And the brother of ignorance in misery enjoys life.
The little from the mean hurts by his nature / He who does not decrease as he decreases and is mean.
Injustice is from the nature of souls; if you find / One of chastity, perhaps he does not oppress.
Of stupidity is blaming him who does not desist / From his ignorance, and addressing him who does not understand.
Of enmity is what its benefit reaches you / And of friendship is what harms and hurts.
The actions of him whom the noble birth are noble / And the deeds of him whom the foreigners birth are foreign.
Worry ravages the huge body into leanness / And turns the forelock of the boy gray and ages him.

He also said:
The home of pleasures is not a home to me / If I am not revered at it and honored.
I am forbearing with my friend and I know that / Whenever I repay him with forbearance for ignorance, he regrets.
If a human gave me the giving of a frowning one / I repaid with the giving of the smiling leaver.
Not every lover of the beautiful is a doer of it / Nor is every doer of it a completer.
The best face in creation is the face of a doer of good / And the most blessed hand among them is the hand of a benefactor.

He also said:
The most tired of God's creation is he whose ambition increased / And his capacity fell short of what the soul desires.

He also said:
Not everything a man wishes he attains / Winds run with what ships do not desire.
Joy does not last as long as you are happy with it / Nor does sadness return the missed to you.
I accompany my forbearance while it is generosity in me / And I do not accompany my forbearance while it is cowardice in me.
I do not stay on wealth by which I am humiliated / Nor do I enjoy what dirties my honor.

He also said:
For the secret there is a place in me that no / Drinking companion reaches, nor does drink lead to it.
The dearest place in the world is the saddle of a swimmer (horse) / And the best sitter in time is a book.

He also said:
Indeed the wound bleeds after a while / If the building is upon corruption.
And water flows from inanimate rock / And fire comes out of flint.

He also said:
And your secret in the entrails is dead / If the secret is resurrected, it is not resurrected (hidden).
Spreading what I am entrusted with / Is of treachery, and the free man does not betray.
Whenever I am capable of a speech / I am more capable of leaving it.

He also said:
Whoever is humiliated, humiliation becomes easy for him / A dead man feels no pain from a wound.
Bearing harm and seeing its perpetrator / Is food by which bodies wither.

He also said:
If generosity is not provided as salvation from harm / Then praise is not gained nor is wealth remaining.

He also said:
If you honor the noble, you own him / And if you honor the mean, he rebels.
Placing dew in the place of the sword with height / Is harmful like placing the sword in the place of dew.
Whoever makes the lion a hawk for his hunting / The lion hunts him among what he hunts.

He also said:
Horses are only like the friend, few / Even if they are many in the eye of him who does not test.
If you witness nothing but the beauty of their colors / And their limbs, then beauty is hidden from you.
Every man who bestows beauty is loved / And every place that grows might is good.

He also said:
Every path the youth came to / According to the man is the step in it.
Whoever's soul is ignorant of his worth / Others see in him what he does not see.

He also said:
If the coward is alone in a land / He seeks stabbing alone and fighting.

He also said:
Were it not for hardship, all people would be masters / Generosity impoverishes and advancing is killing.
We are in a time where leaving the ugly / Is, for most people, kindness and beauty.

He also said:
Leave me to attain what is not attained of height / For the difficult of height is in the difficult, and the easy is in the easy.
You want to meet heights cheaply / There must be bee stings before the honey.

He also said:
Among loved ones is one specific with passion / And another claims partnership with him.
If tears resemble each other on cheeks / It becomes clear who cried from who pretended to cry.

He also said:
Not everyone who seeks heights penetrates them / Nor are all men stallions.

He also said:
If forbearance is not in the nature / Advancing of birth (age) does not make forbearing.
If there is a crack in the spear shafts / Recklessness occurs in the chests of spears.

He also said:
Leave a dress for him who verifies it / Not every bleeding forehead is a worshiper.
The matter belongs to God, the Lord of a striver / He did not fail except because he strove.

And for him:

If the youth is accustomed to wading into deaths / The easiest thing he passes by is mud.

He also said:
With this, days decreed among their people / Calamities of a people are benefits to a people.

And for him:
All tubes of spears are support for him / And nothing pricks the knights but the working ends.

And for him:
The best of birds are on palaces, and the worst of them / Takes refuge in ruins and inhabits the tombs.

He also said:
Nothing is correct in minds / If the day needs a proof.

Chapter Three: Erotic Poetry (Nasib)

Ibn Al-Dumayna said:
O East Wind of Najd, when did you blow from Najd? / Your night travel has increased my passion upon passion.
Is it because a dove cooed in the splendor of the morning / On a branch fresh of plant from the Rand tree?
I wept as the child weeps, and I ceased not / To be sturdy, but I revealed what you did not reveal.
They claimed that the lover, if he draws near / Gets bored, and that distance heals from passion.
With everything we treated ourselves, but nothing healed what is in us / Based on that, nearness of the house is better than distance.
However, nearness of the house is not beneficial / If the one you love is not possessing affection.

For Al-Samma bin Abdullah Al-Qushayri:
You yearned for Rayya, while your soul distanced / Your visiting place from Rayya, and a branch (path) as you were together.
It is not good that you come to the matter willingly / And panic because the caller of love made you hear.
I remember the days of the sanctuary, then I bend / Over my liver fearing it might crack.
The evenings of the sanctuary are not returning / To you, but let your eyes tear up.

Ibn Al-Dumayna said:
The heart does not recover except when appears to it / An imagination of a summer from Su'ad and a dwelling.
I deceive the eye about her ruins, for / Whenever your eye recognizes the ruins, it tears up.
I knew it as wild, having veils upon it / And these are wild animals that have become unveilled.

For another:
O Lord, if I die and my skull is not quenched / With Layla, I die - no grave is thirstier than my grave.
If I am consoled from Layla, then / I was consoled out of despair, I did not console out of patience.
If there is richness and endurance from Layla / Many a richness of soul is close to poverty.

For Abu Sakhr Al-Hudhali:
By Him who makes weep and laugh, and Him who / Causes death and life, and Him whose command is the Command.
She left me envying the wild animals when I see / Two mates of them not frightened by panic.
O her love, increase me in burning every night / And O solace of lovers, your appointment is the Resurrection.
I wondered at the striving of time between me and her / When what was between us ended, time settled.

He also said:
There was a separation in death for us / But you hastened the separation before death.
As long as you remain, a burning will remain / Between the ribs, weakening my body.
There is no good for us in life if you are far / Nor is there any taste to living.
So know that I have been burdened with you / Then do what you wish based on knowledge.

For another:
You were, when you sent your glance as a scout / For your heart one day, the sights tired you.
You saw what you are not capable of entirely / Nor are you patient from some of it.

Another said:
I say to my companion while the white camels drop / With us between Al-Manifa and Al-Dimar.
Enjoy the scent of the Arar of Najd / For there is no Arar after the evening.
O how lovely are the breezes of Najd / And the scent of its garden after the rain.
And your family, when the tribe settles in Najd / And you are not blaming your time.
Months pass and we did not feel / Their halves nor the end of the month.

For another:
When I saw the haters followed / Our love and showed a sidelong glance before us.
I started, while I have no repulsion or hate / Visiting you one day and abandoning you a month.

Ibn Harma said:
Save your tears, weeping will not destroy it / And hold back tears from your eye that race.
The tear ducts, even if generous, are not remaining / Nor the eyelids for this, nor the pupils.

For another:
I used to be above love for a while, but / Undoing and twisting ceased not with me until it rose over me.
I have not seen two friends of strangeness like us / More intense in mutual purity despite the enemy.
Two friends, we do not hope for meeting, and you do not see / Two friends but they hope for meeting.

For Al-Hussein bin Mutayr:
O wonder at people looking up at me / As if they did not see a lover after me nor before me.
They say to me: Cut off, the whole mind returns / But cutting off the beloved of the soul takes the mind away more.

And O wonder at the love of one who is my killer / As if I repay her affection for my killing.

Ibn Al-Dumayna said:
When she saw that there was no connection and that / The extent of separation had its pavilion pitched over us.
She shot me with a glance; if she had shot an armed hero with it / He would have wet his throat and coat with blood.
And a glance with her eyes, as if its flash / Is the flash of rain, its anemones guide to Najd.

Abu Al-Tamhan Al-Qayni said:
Distract me before the wailing of wailers / And before the ascent of the soul above the ribs.
And before tomorrow, O grief of my soul for tomorrow / When my companions go and I am not going.

Another said:
Is passion anything but that if my heart approached / The embers the distance of a spear, the embers would burn?
Is it true that I am fond of you, wandering / And that you are neither the vinegar of your passion nor wine?
If I am medically treated (enchanted), may I remain like this / And if I am bewitched, may the magic not be cured.

Another said:
Lovers complained of affection; I wish I / Bore what they meet of their separation alone.
So all the pleasure of love would be for my soul / And no lover would meet it, my heart, nor after me.

For Jabir bin Al-Thalab Al-Jarmi:
A seeker of news about the secret of Rayya, I returned him / With a blind news of Rayya without certainty.
He said: Advise me, for I am an advisor to you / And I am not trustworthy if I inform him.

For another:
All calamities of time I found / Except the separation of loved ones, easy in impact.

For another:
We spent the night between that and musk / O wonder at a life if it lasted.

He said:
If an hour is delayed, make it / For good, for time is crooked, possessing riot.
If there is good or there is some rest / Then you will meet worries and distress.

Another said:
I love the land Sulayma dwells in / Even if droughts inherit it.
My time is not for love of the soil of a land / But he who settles in it is a beloved.
O blamer, if you drank wine until / There was a creeping for every fingertip.
Then you would excuse me and know that I am / Correct in what I destroyed of my money.

For another:
I was informed Layla sent an intercession / To me; why isn't Layla's self her intercessor?
Is she more noble than Layla to me, that she seeks / Status through her, or was I a man who does not obey her?

For another:
The buttocks and breasts refused for her shirt / To touch the bellies and to touch backs.
When the winds blew with the evening / They alerted an envier and excited a jealous one.

For Bakr bin Al-Nattah:
A white woman dragging her hair from standing / And disappearing in it while it is abundant, black.
As if in it is a bright day / And as if it is a dark night upon her.

Another said:
I contemplated her while she was unaware, as if / I saw in her a rising place from the slumber of the full moon.
Whenever I filled the eye with her, I filled it / With tears until the tears were all drained.

For Kuthayyir:
I wished, and wishing is of no avail, that I / Knew what is in the conscience of the Hajibi woman.
If it was good, it pleased me and I knew it / And if it was evil, the blaming women would not blame me.
The soul did not mention you except it separated / Into two teams, one excusing me and one blaming.

He also said:
You are the one who made Shaghab to Bada dear / To me, and my homelands are lands other than them.
If my eyes shed tears, I make excuse with the mote / And Azza, if the doctor knew, is their mote.
She settled in this a settlement, then became / In another, so both valleys became pleasant.

Al-Numayri said:
The belly of Na'man diffuses musk if / Zainab walked in it among perfumed women.

For Kuthayyir:
I wondered at my recovery from you, O Azza, after / I lived a time from you not healthy.
If the recovery of the soul from you is a relief to me / Then I have recovered if that is my relief.
The cover of the head was revealed from me / And the cover of my heart almost did not reveal for a removal.

For Nusayb:
A dove cooed in the darkness of night / On a branch at midnight while I was asleep.
I lied, by the House of God, if I were a lover / The doves would not have beaten me to weeping.

For Di'bil Al-Khuza'i:
When his heart refused anything but stubbornness / And did not find solace from Layla with money or family.
He sought solace with another besides her, but the one / He sought solace with incites for Layla and does not console.

Another said:
When an inclination from you appeared to me with the enemies / Other than me, and no substitute occurred for you.
I turned away as the wounded turns away; prolonged / Was the period of days for him while he is slain.

For another:
Is it love upon love while you are stingy? / And they claimed that a stingy one does not love.

Indeed, in us, if you knew, is a thirst / For you, just as there is thirst in the hovering (camels).

Another said:
If distance does not console you from whom you love / Nor does length of meeting heal you.
Then are you anything but borrowing a spirit / For a soul's blood that signaled separation?

For Ibrahim bin Janab Al-Kalbi:
If you wish to forget a beloved / Then increase the number of nights without him.
Nothing consoles your friend like distance / Nor wears out your new thing like daily use.

For Kuthayyir:
You drew me near until, when you owned me / With a saying that unties the protection of the easy plains.
You refrained from me when I had no trick / And left what you left between the ribs.

For Umara bin Aqil:
They exposed the hunting ground, then shot us / With arrows, not with the straying missing ones.
Weak women killing men without blood / O wonder at the weak killers.
The eye has a distraction in the old property, and nothing led / The passion of the soul like the leading of new things.

Another said:
If the coldness of her upper canine teeth guides / To one poorer than me, I am indeed poor.
How abundant are the news that she married / Will a bringer of glad tidings come to me with divorce?

Another said:
It soothes my eye to see the sands of Al-Ghada / Whenever its hills appear to my eye one day.
And I am not, even if I loved who dwells in Al-Ghada / The first to hope for a need he does not attain.

Ibn Al-Dumayna said:
Ask the lush Ban tree at the sandy hill which / Has the Ban tree: Did I greet the ruins of your house?
And did I stand in their shades in the evening / The standing of a miserable man, and chose that?
And did my eyes pour in the house in the morning / With tears like a string of falling pearls?
I see people hoping for spring, but / My spring which I hope for is the gift of your connection.
I see people fearing the drought years, but / My drought years which I fear are the changes of your bearing.
If it saddened me that you inflicted a bad deed on me / It pleased me that I crossed your mind.
Congratulations to you for my holding my hand on my entrails / And the tear of my eye, fearing your departure.
If you said 'Step in the fire', I would know that / It is satisfaction for you or bringing us near to your connection.

For Tawba bin Al-Humayr:
If Layla Al-Akhyaliyya greeted / Me while soil and stones are between us.
I would greet the greeting of cheerfulness, or an owl / A crying owl from the side of the grave would screech to her.
I envy Layla for what I do not attain / Indeed, everything the eye is cooled by is good.
If Layla were in the sky, I would ascend / With my glance to Layla, the hostile eyes.

Nusayb said:
As if the heart, the night it was said: Is gone early / With Layla Al-Amiriya or gone in the evening.
Is a sandgrouse deceived by a trap, so she spent the night / Pulling at it while the wing was caught.

Abu Hayya Al-Numayri said:
She shot me while God's curtain was between me and her / And we were at the sides of Hijaz, decayed.
If only when she shot me, I had shot her / But my time with archery is old.

Another said:
Is it prison, shackles, yearning, and a tear / And distance of a beloved? This is indeed the great thing.
A man whose covenants of promise last / On the like of what I met is indeed noble.

For another:
By God, is this one increased in saltiness / And beauty over women, or do I have no mind?

Abu Dahbal Al-Jumahi said:
Shall I leave Layla while there is nothing between me and her / Except a night? I would then be patient.
May God forgive Layla in the morning, for she / If she takes charge of a judgment against me, is unjust.

Abu Bakr bin Abdul Rahman Al-Zuhri said:
When we descended a dwelling bedewed by dew / Elegant, and a garden adorned with blossoms.
The goodness of the place and its beauty renewed for us / Desires, so we wished, and you were the desires.

For Ma'dan bin Al-Mudarrib Al-Abdi:
The love of Layla cleared as long as it cleared, then she did not obey / An enemy, nor did she listen regarding him to the saying of a companion.
But when the love of Layla turned to a side / And a people turned, we turned to a people and a side.

Ibn Al-Dumayna said:
By my soul and my family is the one who, if they exposed him / To some harm, does not know how to answer.
And does not offer the excuse of the innocent, and silence / Ceases not with him until it is said: Suspicious.

Another said:
By your life, the appointment of your eyes and weeping / At Dara is only that a south wind blows.
I associate in Dara with whom I do not love / And at the sands, a beloved is abandoned to me.
If the upper winds blow, I find myself / As if I am related to the upper winds.

Another said:
Is love anything but a sigh after a sigh / And heat on the entrails having no coldness?

And the overflow of eye tears, O Mayy, whenever / A landmark from your land appeared that used not to appear.

For another:
The enemies say: May God not bless the enemies / He has shortened from Layla and his means are worn out.
If Layla came to crawl on a stick / The love of Layla, its beginnings, would be new.

For another:
There is no one in time more miserable than a lover / Even if he finds passion sweet to taste.
You see him weeping at every time / Fearing separation or out of yearning.

For Yazid bin Al-Tathriya:
O friend of the soul, who has no one besides her / As a friend among the friends of purity.
O you whose love we hid, no enemy / Obeyed regarding it, nor was an intruder trusted with it.
Is there a way for me to you from a place / In which I complain of the strangeness of distance and fear of enemies?
Is a look not little if you looked it / At me? And all that is from you is not little.
May I be your ransom! My enemies are many and my distance / Is far, and my followers with you are few.
You were such that if I came, you came with an excuse / So you exhausted my excuses, so how shall I speak?
Not every day do I have a need in your land / Nor every day do I have a messenger to you.
Scrolls of blame I have, I folded them / They will be spread one day, and the blame is long.
Do not carry my sin while you are weak / For carrying my blood on the Day of Reckoning is heavy.

Another said:
The separating distance did not create between us / Solace, nor did the length of meeting create mutual hate.
My two friends, if you do not weep for me, I will seek help / From a friend; if I exhaust tears, he weeps for me.
As if there was no separation if there was after it / A meeting, but I do not think there is meeting.

For Ubaidullah bin Abdullah Al-Hudhali:
You split the heart then sprinkled in it / Your passion; it healed so the cracks healed.
The love of Athma penetrated into my heart / So its apparent part is easy with the hidden part.
It penetrated where no drink reached / Nor sadness, and no joy reached.

For Ibn Mayada:
Whatever I forget of things, I do not forget her saying / While her tears sprinkle the filling of the kohl containers.
Enjoy this short day, for it is / A hostage to the long days of months.

For another:
White, pleasant of speech, as if she is / A moon mediating under a cold wing (darkness).
Marked with beauty, possessing enviers / Indeed the beautiful women are a place for envy.
You see her tear ducts shedding a black / Eye (tear) desiring away from the blackness of antimony.

For Hussein bin Mutayr:
I was defending the eye from reaching weeping / But it reached what I was defending it from.
My two friends, there is no blame in life if we / Found someone to return the days of the sanctuary.
I have a look after repulsion from burning / Like the look of a bereaved mother whose child was stricken.
Does God pardon sins that passed / Or does God, if He does not pardon them, return them?

Another said:
I fear you out of reverence, though you have no power / Over me, but the filling of the eye is a beloved.
The soul did not abandon you because you are to it / Little, but my share of you is little.

For another:
To God you belong! I am connecting what you connected me with / And praising what you bestowed on me and rewarding.
And taking what you gave willingly, and I / Turn away from what you hate, fearful.
Do not leave my soul dispersed / For from passion it has almost melted over you.
I am indeed shy of you until as if / There is a watcher over me from you in the unseen.

For another:
The two old water skins of Kharqa, weak of kidneys / A water carrier watered with them but did not get wet.
Are not more wasting of water than your eye is for tears whenever / You imagined a quarter or remembered a dwelling.

For Abu Al-Shis Al-Khuza'i:
Passion stopped with me where you are, so I have / No going back from it nor going forward.
I find blame in your love delicious / Out of love for your mention, so let the blame blame me.
You resembled my enemies so I became loving them / Since my luck from you became my luck from them.
You humiliated me so I humiliated myself submissively / He who is easy to you is not among those I honor.

For another:
By the dancers (camels) at Dhat Irq / And whoever prayed at Na'man of the Arak.
I have concealed your love in my heart / And I have not concealed love for other than you.
You obeyed those ordering you to cut my rope / Order them regarding their loved ones with that.
If they obey you, then obey them / And if they disobey you, disobey who disobeyed you.

Abu Al-Qamqam Al-Asadi:
Read peace to Al-Washal and say to it / All drinking places since you abandoned are blameworthy.
May there be rain for your shade in the evening and morning / And for the coolness of your water, while waters are hot.
If I possessed the prevention of your water, no mean person / Would attain what is in your rock-pools as long as I live.

Ibn Al-Dumayna said:
You are the one who burdened me with night travel / While the dark sandgrouse are crouching at the two banks.
You are the one who cut my heart with pain / And peeled the sore of the heart, so it is wounded.
You are the one who angered all my people / Far of satisfaction, near of repulsion, silent.

Umama answered him:
You are the one who broke what you promised me / And made those who blamed me about you rejoice at me.
You exposed me to the people until you left me / A target for them to shoot at, while you are safe.
If a saying that wounds the body could appear / Wounds would appear on my body from the saying of slanderers.

For Ibn Al-Dumayna:
When you are angry at me, I spend the night as if I / At night am stealing sleep, stung (by a snake).
I wanted patience from you but I was hindered by / An attachment in my heart from your love, old.
It remains despite the event of time and its doubt / And despite your roughness; indeed, it is noble.

Jamil said:
What might the slanderers say / Except to say that I am a lover of you?
Yes, the slanderers spoke truth; you are dear / To us, even if morals did not clear from you.
The night encloses upon me the layers of her love / Just as the gores enclose the buttons of the shirt.

Another said:
The slanderers did not cease until they threw us / And until hearts turned away from hearts.
Until we saw the best connection between us / Silence, no slanderer peeling (spreading) evil.

For another:
If the days return between me and her / At Dhu Al-Athl a summer like my summer and my dwelling.
I will tie to the necks of distance after this / Ropes which, if I pulled them, would not break.

Ziyad bin Jamil said:
Ruwayq, by Him whom the pilgrims perform Hajj for / And for whom the sanctity raised voices at the sides of Nakhla.
Since I did not meet you, no life consoled me / Regarding you, nor did mention of you make me forget.
No beautiful woman shared with you in my view afterwards / No, by Him whom blessings belong to in my view.

Amr bin Dubay'a Al-Raqashi said:
The eyelids of patience narrow for her tears / So she sheds them after endurance and patience.
And a lump in the chest I showed, so it relieved / The burning of heat in the ribs and chest.
Let whoever wishes say what he wishes; only / The youth is blamed for what he can do of the matter.
God decreed the love of the Malikite woman, so be patient / With it, for matters run according to a decree.

For Mirdas bin Hammam Al-Tai:
I loved you until love almost killed me / And visited you until every companion blamed me.
Until your relatives saw softness from me / Towards them; were it not for you, my side would not have softened.
O how lovely is blame! Modesty! And perhaps / I granted love to one who is not approaching.
My soul is a ransom for gazelles from Rabi'a Amir / Sweet of front teeth, high of buttocks (or bags).

For some of Banu Asad:
I followed passion, O Tayyib, until as if I / Because of you am bitten by the rope, led.
He was rough for a time then obeyed his people / So the trainers turn him where they want.
The driving away of love from you, when / Signs of passion appeared to my eye, is indeed severe.
Not everything in the soul is shown to people / Nor can we drive away all we cannot bear.
I hope for connection from you just as / The thirsty of belly hopes, seeking water places whose rocks are hard.
How is my seeking the connection of one whom if I asked / For the mote of the eye, it would not be sought (given), and that is little?
And who, if she saw my soul flowing, would say to me / 'I see you healthy and the heart is sturdy.'

Another said:
I and you are like the thirsty who saw a drink / And before it is a chasm in which destruction is feared.
He saw with his eyes water whose resource is difficult / And he does not possess a turning away from the water.

Another said:
I am, regarding the abandonment of your house, like one who / Saw a drink while quenched, not thirsty.
He sees a full moon of water he was pushed away from, and a garden / Cool in the morning, lush in the evenings.

For another:
Desires! If they are true, they are the best desires / Otherwise, we have lived by them a time in comfort.

Another said:
My two friends, the love of Kharqa has become my afflicter / In the heart from it are a heaviness and cracks.
If Kharqa neighbored us this year, we would not care / About our drought unless a spring rains.

Another said:
Visit the house which, had you found / Its people in it, its midday rest would not be wild.
Even if it is only a stopping of an hour / A little, for its little is beneficial to me.

Another said:
What is it to you if you heard I am sick / A hostage of death one day, that you visit us?
Or put a drop in the cup, cold / And dip your mouth in it then give us to drink.

Jamil Buthayna said:

Buthayna, there is no defect in her when you look closely / Nor is there gray hair in her when you trace lineage.
She has the first look against them and an extension / If eyes repeat, she has the outcome.
If she is unadorned, leaving decoration does not shame her / And in her, if she adorns herself for a fastidious one, is sufficiency.

Another said:
My companions departed and did not find my passion / People have sorrows, and I have a sorrow alone.
I love them as long as I live; if I die / Then woe to my liver from who loves you after me.

Al-Harithi said:
You stripped my bones of their flesh and left them / Bare, exposed to you and cold.
You emptied them of their marrow and left them / Tubes in whose hollows the wind whistles.
If they hear the name of separation, their joints / Rattle from the terror of what they wait for.
Take my hand then rise with me, verify / The harm in me, except that I cover myself.
What is my trick if you have no mercy / On me, nor do I have patience from you to be patient?
It is not water that flows from the eye / But it is a soul melting and dripping.
By God, I did not fall short in what I think is / Your satisfaction, but I am a lover denied (favors).

For Ariq Al-Tai:
Greet before separation him whom you love / And him whom you yearn for and who yearns for you.
And him whose house does not suit except for a while / And him whom you weep for every day you separate from.

Another said:
I love you a love after which I will not blame / A lover, but if he is blamed, I excuse him.
I held back my tears lest they be a spy / On the secret of my soul when its drops pour.

For another:
Is there in every year travelers to Najd and Tihama? / And in every year a journey and a march?
I used to think that nothing would separate us / But the deceiving world is a deception.
Your entry from the door of passion, if you entered it / Is easy, but the exit is difficult.

For another:
A slender-waisted one signaled separation; would that she / Signaled to us with it while the heart was whole.
I am, even if they faced me... / Like the sword, the scabbard wears out while it is polished.
I hope for youth after fifty years / Congratulations to me on the lack of greed for a greedy one.

For another:
The days were, when we were at Al-Liwa / Beautiful to me, if that beauty lasted.
But a time after that turned / For us from its sides backs and bellies.
I am, although I have consoled myself after you / And turned away until the possessor of grudge almost lined (his stomach).
Like the sick telling the visitors that he is / Recovering from what he has, while he is critically ill.

For Mahdi bin Al-Mulawwah:
May rain water a land Salma spent the evening settling / From the cloud, what quenches and... and grazes.
Even if I am not among its dwellers, for / A person dear to me settles in it.
O how lovely is one whose peer has no equal / To me, even if the visiting place is far, a bliss.
A beloved and a companion blamed me for him / So a companion and an intimate friend were rejected with rage.

Another said:
She appeared, so I said: The sun at its rising / With a skin rich in color without the trace of Wars (dye).
When I repeated the glance, I said to my companion / With doubt: Is the rising of the sun here?

Another said:
Indeed... beneath it are the peaks of the sanctuary / The desire of the soul if its watering places were attained.
I showed you if the intention went far with you this year / And the summer resort of the sanctuary and its spring quarters took you away.

For Bayhas Al-A'iri:
Did you not see Dhamya of the nets exchanged / A substitute and untied her rope from my ropes?
My soul and family are a ransom for one whom if I found / At the sea and asked for water, would not give me water.
And one whom if he saw enemies shooting arrows at me / As a target for them to shoot, would shoot me.
And one for whom if I disobeyed people all together / And cut off my friends for him, would shun me.
I count the nights, night after night / To the meeting; distraction does not count the nights.

For Mirdas bin Abi Amir:
Salma was alone in hills and a thicket / So no one is capable of her on that day.
She threw her staff and the distance settled with her / As the traveler is cooled of eye by return.

For Sawwar bin Mudarrib:
Two birds sang of the separation of Salma / On two branches of willow and Ban.
The Ban was that Salma separated (Banat) / And in the willow (Gharb) is estrangement (Ightirab) not near.

For Khalifa bin Ruh Al-Asadi:
Ask Umm Sahl: Is wealth as she knew it? / And money she contained after us and a friend?
By God, ask her: Did her night lengthen? / Just as the night, since she disappeared from me, lengthens?

For Sama'a Al-Asadi:
O blamer, were it not for the preciousness of her love / Upon you, I would not have cared that you know it.

I was such that if I was entrusted with a secret, I folded it / With preservation, when the spreader wastes the secret.
I indeed protect my companion in absence / Out of modesty, just as I protect him when I am present.
My heart was in a veil covering it / So your love, without the veil, we engage.

For Muhajir bin Ubaid Al-Asadi:
I yearn for Layla and think that I am / Dear to Layla, while other than me is her dear one.
If she preferred with love the people of her land / Over a distant one from her land, I do not blame her.
He who sees nothing but a glimpse is not equal / To him who is staying with her, not leaving.

For Jamil:
I think her love is leaving me in a waste / Of the earth; no wealth with me nor family.
No one to whom I entrust my will / Nor an heir except the mount and the saddle.

Another said:
My enemy tells my secrets, and I am / Stingy regarding its secret lest it be permitted.
I fold the secret in the concealed entrails / To meet you one day while the skin is sound.

Another said:
If you wish to hide what is wrong with me, then bind / My tears and let go of my sleep so I may sleep.
You are the one who settled me in the courtyard of passion / And accustomed my tears to a habit, so they became accustomed.

Another said:
I say to the water of the eye: Flow, perhaps / It will testify to what is not seen of the absent face.
I have not seen like the eye stingy with its water / To me, nor like me envied for tears.

Another said:
As if my heart is the crack of a broken leg / Its healer is rough, slow of mending.
If they bind it with splints, it hurts / And if they leave it, the crack grows its hole.

Another said:
I was attached to Layla while she had braids / Returning the throws to us in the evening.
The sons of Layla grew up and the sons of... grew up / And the attachments of Layla in the heart are as they are.

Al-Tahman said:
My two friends, I am today complaining to you / Does complaint benefit to one who increases it?
The sons of Layla grew up and the sons of... grew up / I remain driving her away with the tips of fingers.
My two friends, tighten the bandages and look / At my liver; did its pillars become a crack?
The slanderers will not delay breaking the stick / If its wood is not hard against the whittler.

Omar bin Abi Rabi'a said:
Sukayna said, while tears were shedding / From her on the cheeks and the cloak.
I wish Al-Mughiri, whom I did not reward / For what he prolonged of my hunting and seeking.
Our desires would return our days to us / When we are not blamed for passion and youthful love.
I was informed of what she said, so I spent the night as if / The entrails were shot with penetrating arrows.
Is Sukayna! Not the water of the Euphrates and its goodness / To us when thirsty, and the love of drink.
Sweeter than you, even if you are far, and rarely / Do women observe the trust of the absent.

For Bakr bin Al-Nattah:
I lied to my glance about you, and the glance is truthful / And I made my ear hear about you what it does not hear.
I did not dwell in the land you dwell in / So that they say 'Patient, not panicking'.
I met matters regarding you I met none like them / And greater than them from you is what I expect.
Neither does my grief wear out, nor do you have mercy / Nor is there refraining from you, nor is there hope in you.

Nusayb said:
Indeed Layla Al-Amiriya has become / On distance, resenting me for the sin of another.
That is not for a crime I committed / Against her, so she repays me for it where I know.
But a human, if he gets bored of a companion / And attempts separation, ceases not to find faults.
The ones who were a friend, an intimate lining / To us, the most kind of them became the frowning one.

A woman from Kilab said:
You are the one who broke what you promised me / And distanced for me what is not distant.
You made enemies rejoice at me when you abandoned me / And left me being shot with the arrows of my intenders.

Another said:
Buthayna is of the women; indeed / They are for the nearest, no connection for an absent one.
They betray the innocent whose heart is reassured / And swear oaths while they are lying.

Another said:
If I die, bury me at the root of a vine / Its roots quench my bones after my death.
Do not bury me in the desert, for I / Fear, when I die, that I will not taste it.

For another:
Leave me to age my worry with wine, for I / See time has distress and straits in it.
I am nothing but like time; if it clears / I clear, and if time becomes foolish, I become foolish.

For another:
The spirit is stolen if I do not meet you / So if we meet, it returns into the spirit.

Another said:
If what I complain to you, I complained / To a stone, it would crumble or crack.

You turn away from one whom if he were certain that / It is a turning away of cutting off from you, would be cut to pieces.

Another said:
Is it not in the changes of time that love returns? / And since when do Arabs get bored of distance one day?
Yes, in the changes of time is all that I see / But they neglected my luck intentionally.

Al-Abbas bin Al-Ahnaf said:
If you were blaming, my anguish would calm / My hope for your satisfaction, and I would visit without observing.
But you got bored, so I had no trick / The repulsion of the bored is different from the repulsion of the blaming.

Another said:
Indeed, the saying of the sayers that / The hearts of lovers are repaid is false.
What is wrong with my heart, like a wing in its beating / While your heart is heedless of what my heart is in?

Another said:
You distract me with promises until as if I am / A farmer of cumin distracted by the promise.
I have from you what, if it were in the rock, it would demolish it / And with ecstasy, ecstasy melted from the intensity of ecstasy.

Another said:
I will conceal her love in the unseen as long as / Breathing and tears do not reveal it.
There is no hour but that for Salma / Even if she is stingy, there is an intercessor to my soul.

Another said:
O you whose cheeks eyes were occupied with, away from gardens / So they walked in what they saw of rosiness and whiteness.
If you are pleased with repulsion, then I am pleased with repulsion.
To here Ibn Faris recited in his Hamasah.

Jamil bin Abdullah bin Ma'mar said:
I was attached to passion from her as a child, and it ceased not / To this day, her love grows and increases.
I exhausted my life waiting for her gift / And time wore out her passion while it is new.
I am not returned with what I came seeking / Nor does her love perish among what perishes.
Women from the tribe think that I / When I come to them, I want (them).
So I divide my glance among them so it is equal / While in the chest there is a far difference between them.
Passion dies in me when I come to her / And lives when I part from her, so it returns.

He also said:
My two friends, in what you lived, have you seen / A slain one weeping for the love of his killer?
My heart! If she is near, nearness does not benefit with her / And if she is far, she increases you insanity upon insanity.

Ghulam bin Fazara said:
I turn away until people think that / I have abandonment; no, by God, I do not have abandonment for you.
But I train the soul, looking: Does it / If it separates one day from its loved ones, have patience?

For another:
I am shy a lot and fear / Eyes, and I preserve affection by abandonment.
I vow abandonment to my soul, training it / To know, at abandonment, do I have patience?

Al-Tawzi said:
Your eyes demanded tears for her distance / Just as a creditor demands debts from you.
If I knew that what was to be / I would have abandoned you the days the heart was sound.
But I thought abandonment was something I could bear / And I did not have, in what I thought, determination.

Al-Zubair bin Bakkar said:
I feared for her from the length of her connection / So I abandoned her for two days for fear of abandonment.
My abandonment of her was not out of boredom / But I tested my soul for patience.

For another:
I have a look after repulsion from burning / Like the look of a bereaved mother whose child was stricken.
If what you left of me were hung / On a stick of Thumam, the stick would not bend.

For some Bedouins:
When I came complaining of love, she said: Do you not see / The place of the Pleiades while it is far from you?
So I said to her: Indeed the Pleiades, even if far / Over people, generously give clouds of old.

The Bedouin:
They say: Do not drain your tears with weeping / I said: Do lovers have tears?
My soul falls as breaths, fond of her / And indeed, other than (her)... if I die while she is whole.

Another said:
By your life, the day they departed and I did not die / Fading away on their traces, I was indeed patient.
The morning of Al-Munaqqa, when I was shot with a glance / While we were walking on the back of the road.
The tears of the eye overflowed until as if / With its looker is a branch watered by rain.
Is this when a night has not passed for the separation? / So how when months pass over you?
And the landmarks of the loved ones became separated from them / By the earth, a ghoul (distance), far and marching.

Another said:
By my life, if you are, despite distance and wealth / With the like of what I have, you are indeed a friend.
I have not tasted the taste of sleep since I knew you / Nor did saliva flow pleasantly for me between the ribs.
When the sighs of love ascend in the entrails / They repeat and do not know a way for themselves.

For some Bedouins:
O may God fight passion! How severe it is / And how throwing down of man it is, while he is sturdy.

Passion called me from her direction, so I answered it / So it began to run with me where it wants.

Another said:
When she refused anything but being on the edge with her love / And her muddying the drink that was clear.
We drank with spit from her passion, muddied / And the spit is not loathed by one who is thirsty.

Nuwayfi' bin Laqit Al-Faq'asi said:
As if Al-Nawar was not near me / And I did not touch her ownership with my right hand one day.
And I did not embrace her lawfully, and her wrists / Did not spend the night under the bedding consoling me.
And I did not bend with the palms the tips of a delicate girl / Like the fringes of a sheet, preserved in rebuke.
And I was not benumbed on the rainy day by a bliss / With her and a cup grinding the bones.
Yes, then I did not possess decrees of separation / Nor envy from souls and eyes.
The slanderers did not increase me, O Mayy, but an intercessor / With you, and the distance of the house, anything but insanity.

For Jarir bin Abdullah:
My family asks the people: Did the rain fall? / And I ask about Tayy: Where did they settle?
As if I, when it is said 'Distance aided / With a Tayyi woman', find a life I lost.

Yahya bin Talib said:
If a group departed towards Yamama / Passion called me and my heart found rest in the mention.
As if my heart, whenever a rider passes / Is the wing of a crow desiring to rise to a nest.
They say that abandonment heals from burning / I increased nothing but weakness of heart upon abandonment.
Is it true, servants of God, that I am not looking / At Qarqara one day and its dusty landmarks?
I turned away from it unwillingly and left it / And abandoning it is to me more bitter than aloes/patience.
O sorrow for what I met of passion / And of concealed longing, entering, for Hajar.

For another:
May God water the days of youth at Mutali' / And the valley of Al-Sayyal, possessor of Arak and Athl.
And watering and grazing for youth and its time / With the slender, white women with wide eyes.
Among my needs, were it not for modesty, and that I / See people fond of faulting the youthful love of the elder.
My walking with the youths in the courtyard of passion / Competing with their mounts on a tractable, easy one.
And my arriving at waters where I had with their people / With affection, the doubling of passion and giving.
Nothing remained of that pleasure with them / And with me, except the mention of the time and the family.

For Amr bin Shas:
When we traveled at night and you were in front of us / The light of your face was sufficient as a guide for the mounts.
Does it not increase the white camels in lightness of arm / Even if they are weary, that you are in front of me?

Al-Nazzar Al-Faq'asi said:
They say: This Umm Amr is near / A land and a sky approached you to her.
Indeed, the distance of the beloved and his nearness / If he is not reached, are equal.

For Dhu Al-Rumma:
I was weeping while the distance was settled / With us and you, out of knowledge of what separation does.
I abandon you, the abandonment of the hateful, while your love / On my liver has cracking tear ducts from it.

He said again:
