I was weeping while the distance was settled / In caution of what was or is to be.
I did not fear that my death would be / At my hand, except that he who perishes is perishing.

Omar bin Abi Rabi'a:
They claimed she asked her female neighbors / And stripped on a hot day to cool herself.
'Does Omar describe me as God formed me / Or does he not economize (exaggerate)?'
They laughed together and said to her / 'Good in every eye of who loves.'
Envy they carried from her beauty / And of old, envy was among people.

He also said:
I went out on the morning of sacrifice reviewing the statues (beautiful women) / I did not see sweeter than you in eye and heart.
By God, I do not know: Is it beauty you were gifted / Or is love blind as is said in love?

For Bishr bin Uqba Al-Adawi:
I saw you above people, O Umm Malik / Burdened with beauty; he who faults it is silenced.
By God, I do not know: Are you as I see / Or is the eye conceited towards its beloved?

For a man from Qais:
I swore by the desert of Al-Hujun and my she-camel / She has a yearning between the bottom of the two mountains.
A swearing oath: You exceeded in beauty an extent / Over people, or I have madness from your love.

Another said:
A drop that was the extract of a cloud / Grew away from the path of people then shaded.
Is not sweeter than the canine teeth of... / The night drove the heels of the stars so they turned away.
She was stingy until if I asked her / For the mote of the eye from the thirsty dust, she would be stingy.

Al-Hakam bin Qanbar said:
You promised in the morning then broke in the evening / O nearness of a gift, O Aliyya, from a rejection.

Why didn't you leave the promise so it pleases me? / I hope for the gift from it even if it does not give.

For Abu Muhallim Al-A'rabi:
I spend the night watching the star until as if / By my forelock is a rope tied to the star.
My night was not long except that I, for her love / Distract myself with wishes, so I worry.

For another:
I remembered you at night, so the light of your mention / Lit the darkness of night until its darknesses cleared.
I spent the night giving drink to longing until as if I / Was a fallen of wine whose rebuker did not restrain him.
The palms of longing remained, when I remembered you / representing to me an image of you I walk with.
If you were at the furthest lands, I would visit you / To where its arrival and sources weary.
I see a shortness in the night until as if / Its beginnings nearly approach its ends.

Al-Mubarrad said:
To God belongs our period at the black stones of Suwayqa / While life was fresh and time was a pond.
Its days were good so their goodness shortened them / As if the years in them were months.

For Kharija bin Fulayh Al-Malali:
They marched among a herd resembling statues / Thin of teeth, clear of eyes.
They unveil to the night traveler when her night darkens / The path of mounts with the unveiled faces.

For Al-Ba'ith:
Layla visited you while the camels were humble / And the rising stars had dazzled the night.
She gave you the banners of wishes, except that they are / Lying if you attain them, and deceptive.
At the time night gathered from every side / Its wings, and rising stars swooped down.
A shining morning, disturbing the night, hastened her / From a visit I did not win from.

For a man from Banu Ja'da:
Umm Aws did not knock on us while before her / Are flags for the chaste one and soldiers.
When we woke up to the phantom that traveled / Suddenly the earth was wasteland and the visiting place far.
I said to my eye: Return to sleep and look / Perhaps a visiting phantom will return.

Al-Tawzi said:
You see pearls scattered when she speaks / And like pearls strung when she does not speak.
... / And she fills the eye of the scrutinizing onlooker.

Al-Qutami said:
The wind of a bottom possessing khuzama and hanwa plants / Having a fragrance from the scent of the plant, wandering.
Is not better than Mayy when she turns / At night, drowsy, side after side.
Luxurious, polishing with an Arak stick / The peaks of cold, sweet, separate origins (teeth).

For another:
As if her mouth, from its beauty, is hail / From what the hands of the cloud gifted, polished.
As if it is chamomile after a night rain / Continuous, the wind faced it, cooled by the north wind.

Jamil said:
O quarter which decay altered / Effaced and empty after it used not to be empty.
The wind of musk wavers in it, but / Musk is in it because Jumal dragged her tail in it.

Thalab said:
A distancing intention turned away with them from you / Leaving the valley not healed.
The gardens were entrusted with her scent, so they / Do not increase except in goodness upon oldness.

Malik bin Asma Al-Fazari said:
She visited you between a chanter (La ilaha illa Allah) and a glorifier / At the Hatim of Mecca where the valley flows.
As if Mecca and all the sites / And our saddles spent the night exuding musk.

For Jaran Al-Awd:
The soul almost drinks her whenever / Nawar meets it with her breeze.
With a scent that lent perfume a goodness / And a love that is not sold nor lent.

Jamil said:
Is there for a time of Buthayna that has passed / And inherited a grief that does not leave you, a return?
Am I excused if I weep for the one / Whom I see my love grows for upon abandonment?
If the soul tried abandoning her, it would not return / To solace, but would increase in passion upon passion.
No blamer blamed regarding her, if he knew her / Among people, except he increased my love for her.
So do not increase my blame, for I am not the one / Who enacted passion among people or tasted it alone.

Abu Muhallim said:
The mounts are the deaths, and did / Anything separate loved ones like their separation?
Their driver remained driving my heart / Thinking that he drives the mounts.

For Qais bin Dharih:
I feared the soul would not be content after her / With anything of the world, even if convincing.
I blame the soul regarding her when she is blocked / And the soul refuses anything but looking up.

For him also:
You wept, yes you wept, and every mate / If his companion separates, weeps for her.
... out of hate... / But misery reached its extent.
You are wandering with the memory of Lubna / Suffering wherever her intention went far.

For him also:

You spoke to me, O heart, [saying] that you are patient... over the abandonment from Lubna, so you shall taste [the consequences]. You obeyed slanderers among whom you had... no friend, nor a close one compassionate towards you. So die of grief or live tormented, for indeed... you burden me with what I do not see you capable of bearing. Time and the slanderers strove between me and her... so the rope of union was cut while it was strong. He also said: May the summer and spring [rains] water the ruins of the dwelling... where you used to be on the eastern side of Sal'. A time has passed, and people seek intercession through me... so is there an intercessor for me to Laila this morning? They say, 'A man fond of women, entrusted [with them]'... and that is not a strange novelty regarding the virtue of men. To God I complain of an intention that caused a rift... It is scattered today, though yesterday it was united. By your life, indeed I, on the day of the sandy hill of Malik... am disobedient to the command of advisors, obedient [to passion]. I regretted what came from me, a regret... Just as the cheated one regrets when he sells. To Abdullah bin Shabib: They [women] say, having seen my piety and repentance... to God: 'Is this the time for you to repent?' ... [For] a man whose youth is fresh, and for youthful passion... anciently, from fresh youth, there is a share. To Qays bin al-Haddadiyah: Are you serious? If Nu'm moves away, you are anxious... I have drawn near, if only that were useful. I have drawn near, if only in the proximity of her house... there was a benefit, but everyone who grants favor forbids [access]. So if you meet Asma before me, greet her... and ask how deposits are tended to during absence. My thought of her is guarding my absence and tending... to what I asked to be tended, and opinion regarding the unseen is wide. Let no third party hear my secret and your secret... indeed, every secret that passes two is spread. As if my heart on the day of Shaqqayn was one who rebelled... in fear of the occurrence of separation, or it is [already] occurring. And perhaps the youth praises God for patience... and perhaps the gatherers will gather the scattered union. She said, while her eyes were overflowing with tears... 'May I be your ransom, explain to me when you are returning.' I said to her, 'By God, a traveler knows... if the earth conceals him, what God is doing.' So she tightened the veil over her mouth and turned away... and the tear ducts caused the crushed kohl to run. Qays al-Majnun said: Perhaps you will be quenched by a drink from the past... and be pleased with characters that have consequences. And test the connection of those who connect, so you know... the traits of one who purifies love and [one who] taints it. I encountered a surge of agonizing love... that has a creeping sensation between my flesh and bones. This soul has been worn out by the fact that there is no ceasing... of a sorrow for it; what is near is not attainable. Neither does the heart let go of wishes so it may heal... nor is the soul willing to give up what you know. You have God's [oath] that I am connecting what you connected of me... and praising what you bestowed upon me, and rewarding. And taking what you gave freely, and indeed I... turn away from what you dislike, fearful. So do not leave my soul scattered... for out of passion, it has almost melted over you. Another said: May the rain water the solitary mountain in whose shadows... are two kohl-eyed gazelles, united. I sought them as prey, but I could not [catch] them... and [I sought them] by stealth, but they escaped me and killed me. Another said: Verily, perhaps she deceived you during her address... and young maids generated the lying promise. Conversations drop from them fresh... the dropping of pearls surrendered by the necklaces. Umar bin Abi Rabi'ah said: And when she disputes with you in conversation, she takes the edge... of it briefly, and does not desire abundance. The listeners lean towards it for its beauty... as if they are being given wine to drink from it. Na'im al-Nabhani said: We remained for a day at Umm Muhallim's... intoxicated, though we did not drink thick juice or wine. If she fell silent before us, we sobered up at her silence... and if she spoke, it was drunkenness for our minds. Ibn al-Tathriyah said: She killed and revived, through refusal and wishes... a heart shot at, whose fatal spots were hit. And she possesses the enslavement of the soul from me when she nears... [with] scraps of conversation wherein its falsehood defeats the truth. Qays bin Dharih said: If they hide her, or if there stands between her union... the speech of a slanderer or the threat of an emir. They will not prevent my eyes from constant weeping... nor remove what my conscience has concealed. We were all together before passion appeared... in the most blissful state of envy and joy. But the slanderers did not cease until there appeared to us... the bellies of love turned over to be backs. I would have been sufficient for the soul had her union lasted... but the world is a possession of deception. Jamil said: As if there were no distance if there was... a meeting between us, but I do not imagine a meeting.

You told me, O heart, that you are patient / Over the abandonment of Lubna; so you will taste.
You obeyed slanderers among whom you did not have / A friend nor a near one compassionate to you.
So die of grief or live suffering, for / You burden me what I do not see you bearing.
Time and the slanderers strove between me and her / So the rope of connection was cut while it was strong.

He also said:
May a summer and spring water the ruins of the house / Which you were in at the east of Sal'.
A time passed, and people seek intercession through me / So do I have an intercessor to Layla in the morning?
They say: A lover entrusted with women / That is not an innovation from the virtue of men.
To God I complain of an intention that split the stick / It is today scattered, and it was yesterday together.
By your life, I was on the day of Jar'a Malik / Disobedient to the command of the guides, obedient (to love).
I regretted what was from me, a regret / As the cheated regrets when he sells.

For Abdullah bin Shabib:
They say, when they saw my asceticism and repentance / To God: Is this the time you repent?
... a man whose youth was fresh, and for youthful love / Of old, from the fresh youth, is a share.

For Qais bin Al-Haddadiya:
Are you serious? If Nu'm is far, you are panicking / I have been tied (married), if that is beneficial.
I have been tied, if in the nearness of her house / Is a gift, but everyone who bestows is a preventer.
If you meet Asma before me, greet her / And ask how the deposits are tended in absence.
My thought of her is preservation of my absence and tending / To what I entrusted, and the thought of the absent is wide.
Let no third hear my secret and your secret / Behold, every secret that exceeds two is spread.
As if my heart on the day of Shaqqayn, from one who disobeyed / Fear of the befalling of separation, or it is befalling.
Consolation may be praised from the youth / And gatherers may gather the scattered reunion.
She said while her eyes were overflowing with tears / 'My ransom for you, clarify to me when you are returning.'
I said to her: By God, does a traveler know / When the earth hides him, what God is doing?
She tightened the veil on her mouth and turned away / And the tear ducts went far with the crushed kohl.

Qais Al-Majnun said:
Perhaps you are quenched by a drink on the old / And are pleased with morals which have affairs.
You test the connection of connectors, so you know / The morals of who purifies love and who mixes.
I encounter from the painful love a chapter / That has a creeping between my flesh and bones.
It thinned this soul that there is not leaving / It a grief, what is possible is near.
The heart does not empty of wishes so it heals / Nor is the soul pleased to leave what you know.

To you is God (I swear)! I am connecting what you connected me with / And praising what you bestowed on me and rewarding.
And taking what you gave willingly, and I / Turn away from what you hate, fearful.
Do not leave my soul dispersed / For from passion it has almost melted over you.

Another said:
May the single mountain in whose shades / Are two kohl-eyed, united gazelles be watered.
I sought them as prey but could not / And by stealth, but they missed me and killed me.

Another said:
Perhaps she deceived you when addressing her / And the servant girls generated the lying promise.
Fresh conversations fall from them / Falling of pearls surrendered by the knots.

Omar bin Abi Rabi'a said:
When she disputes the conversation with you, you catch / The little from it and do not want increase.
The listeners listen to it for its beauty / As if they are given wine to drink from it.

Na'im Al-Nabhani said:
We remained for a day at Umm Muhallim's / Drunken, and we did not drink potion nor wine.
If she was silent to us, we sobered by her silence / And if she spoke, it was drunkenness to our minds.

Ibn Al-Tathriya said:
She killed and revived by prevention and wishes / A heart, a target, whose killing spots were hit.
She owns the slavery of the soul from me if she approaches / Dropped conversation, its false defeats the truth.

Qais bin Dharih said:
If they veil her or the saying of a slanderer / Or the threat of a prince stands before her connection.
They will not prevent my eyes from constant weeping / Nor will they take away what my conscience has concealed.
We were together before love appeared / In the most comfortable condition of envy and joy.
The slanderers ceased not until appeared to us / Bellies of passion turned over to backs.
I used to be sufficient for the soul if her connection lasted / But the world is goods of deception.

Jamil said:
As if there was no distance if there is between us / A meeting, but I do not think there is meeting.

O do not blame him today for being stupid / The sad one is overcome to be sturdy.
Life is nothing but what is delicious and desired / Even if the hater blames in it and criticizes.
I wept for youth with my effort; whoever wishes blamed me / And whoever wishes comforted in weeping and helped.
If you are refusing of amusement and youth / Then be a stone from the dry rock, solid.
An attachment of love persisted in the ways of youth / It wore out, but it increases only in renewal.

Another said:
They said: The distance thrower consoles; so why / Did she shoot us and increase us in passion upon her distance?
Yes, the lover may hide the burnings of his grief / So you think him sturdy while he has reached the limit.

Al-Numari said:
Dwellings for you at the sanctuary / And the mixture (people) are descending in them.
Their days are short / And their joys are long.
Their lucky stars are rising / And their unlucky stars are setting.
The Malikite woman and youth / And a songstress and wine.

A Bedouin said:
O heart that has been confused / Wake up! He who loved has sobered and refrained.
I lost you as a scattered, fond heart / Will you not be consoled from hate and change?
As if you did not find the pain of youthful love and burning / Pulling the tear of the eye until it renewed.
To God belongs a heart whose resolve longing dispersed / Whenever it is burdened with the root of consolation, it denies.

Nusayb said:
Is it from a ruin you returned to your ignorance after / Patience from them and endurance approached you?
Sorrows surround you until as if / They have an appointment at the remembrance of loved ones.

Ismail bin Yasar said:
If you grant us your coquetry once / We will not seek from you other than your coquetry as forbidden.
What would it harm your family if a lover circumambulated / The courtyard of your house or visited and greeted?

Thalaba bin Aws said:
My friend, I have been sleepless and excited by / A lightning like the pulse of a vein, I spend the night watching it.
I have not seen like love a disease for a Muslim / Nor like what is in me, not leading its companion (to death, just suffering).

Another said:
Aslam, you have owned, so be gentle / The free noble may own and be gentle.
I advise you and know that / Equal to you is he who cheats and he who advises.

For some Hijazis:
The delay was long and persisted in my imprisonment / And I discounted my religion, what a discount.
I spend the evening hoping for you, and my hope / Fails me, and I become like I spent the evening.

Dhu Al-Rumma said:
If Mayya returned the saying to you or appeared / To you, the face of it, or the stripper stripped the armor.
O what a smooth cheek and speech / Melodious, and a character its attractor distracts with.

Al-Murrar said:
When the wild one of Najd descended, there was not / For your eyes, from what they complain, a doctor.
The winds of Sham used to be hated once / Now those winds have begun to be pleasant.

Jamil said:
I am pleased with you, O Buthayn, with that which / If the slanderer were certain of, his anxieties would settle.
With 'No' and with 'I cannot' and with wishes / And with the lied hope whose hoper failed.
And with the hasty glance, and with the year passing / Its ends, not passing its beginnings.

Al-Mundhir bin Al-Ja'd said:
Enough sadness that there ceases not to visit me / In distance, a phantom from your imagination, O Nu'm.
You are like the star in distance; do we have / From the star anything except that the star faces us?

Dhu Al-Rumma said:
Visit the house which, had you found / Its people in it, its midday rest would not be wild.
Even if it is only a stopping of an hour / A little, for its little is beneficial to me.

He also said:
I am, even if you distanced me and abandoned me / It brings me near that I have no way from you.
You are to me in the place in which / The black of the heart settles; rather, you are nearer.
If you tended the stars like my tending / And your eye poured from the water of passion.
You would contain that love is bitter in taste / And that he who loves is miserable, tortured.

Another said:
I lower the glance from her, covering up / And I have a look, were it not for modesty, intense.
... she said: I have attained his love / And stinginess did not harm me, so how shall I be generous?

For another:
By my soul is he who if he says good, fulfills it / And if he says evil, says it while joking.
And whom people shot until he feared them / With hating me, except what the ribs conceal.

Another said:
She spent the night deferring me with the return of her yearning / And I spend the night keeping her awake with the return of my yearning.
Two mates estranged in deserts / They folded the ribs on a hidden passion.

Kuthayyir bin Amr Al-Hilali said:
Layla addressed us in the morning intentionally / To increase sadness after long guarantee.

She broke a heart whose healing was hoped / Over a hardship that had been for a time.
If Layla was content for us with what we have / Of longing and old ecstasy, it would suffice me.
But she did not spare harming me, and I have not / With more than what my hands carried.

Al-Majnun said:
I yearn for Layla and think that I am / Dear to Layla, while other than me is her dear one.
I became having resolved to leave her house / While in the eye from Layla is a mote that does not let it sleep.
If she preferred with love the people of her land / Over a distant one from her land, do not blame her.
He who sees nothing but a glimpse is not equal / To him who is staying with her, not leaving her.

For another:
I met matters regarding you I met none like them / And greater than them is some of what I expect.
Neither does my grief wear out, nor do you have mercy / Nor is there refraining from you, nor is there hope in you.

For Ibn Harma:
If our days have become long / We used to live in them short.
I saw the rich women flee when / They saw gray hair dress me with a cheek-hair.
What do they deny of a shining moon / After his youth, he met the waning?

Al-Majnun said:
My intercessor to her is her heart if she got angry / And my heart is a intercessor for her in what she loves.
She won hearing and obedience from me / And every lover is listening and obedient.

Abu Al-Amaythal said:
Peace be upon the connection that was between us / Its pillars collapsed so it weakened.
Men wished what they loved, and only / I wished to complain to her so she hears.
I forbid the soul from her, and it was not / Content with anything of the world other than her.
I see every two lovers other than me and her / Found the taste of passion sweet and enjoyed.
As if I and she are in a state of surveillance / And separation of a night; we did not spend a night together.

Al-Samhari said:
Hasten with Layla the return of the tribe, for they / Whenever they return, her speech becomes forbidden to you.
Like the flash of lightning between me and her / When her smile came after the calm.

Ibn Al-Dumayna said:
Umaym, you have wearied me and shown me / New morals that have types.
Repulsion and turning away as if I am guilty / While I had no sins but your love.
O sorrow for when I wasted my love / And my heart fluttered for one who didn't know how to reward.
Indeed a doctor who mends the heart after / It cracked from ecstasy for her is a mender.
O sighs of the soul from the strangeness of distance / When intention and death divide us.
And from thoughts that befall me and a sigh / That has a creeping between my skin and bones.
They say: Refrain from her love, for contained / Are grudges of youths against you and gray-haired ones.
She does not care for the anger of who was angry / If a beloved advises one who loves.
If you fear not to judge the time of passion / Return my heart, and the return is near.

He also said:
I am indeed shy of you until as if / There is a watcher over me from you in the unseen.
Were it not that I ask God forgiveness whenever / I mentioned you, no sins would be written against me.

Ibn Sama'a Al-Asadi said:
My soul is a ransom for him who does not approach his abandoner / And him whom I remember in ease and hardship.
And him whom people shot until he feared them / With hating me, except what his conscience conceals.
I love you, O Layla, without suspicion / What good is a love whose secrets are not chaste?
I love you a love after which I will not blame / A love, but I... excuse him.
I hold back my tears lest they be a spy / On the secret of my soul when its drops pour.

To here Abu Hilal Al-Askari recited in his Hamasah.

Qais bin Dharih Al-Udhri said:
I love you types of love we did not find / A likeness for in the rest of people known.
Among them is love for the lover and mercy / And knowledge from me of what he burdens himself with.
And among them is that the mention of you never crosses / The heart except the soul almost perishes.
And a love that appeared in the body and color, visible / And a love in my soul, more subtle than the spirit.
And a love that is the incurable disease itself / It has a mention coming early to me so I become critically ill.
I am not resting from it, so dead / Nor is it lightening from me as long as I live.
O her love, you ceased not until you killed me / Nor are you, if the trial prolongs for me, fair.

He also said:
My soul attached to her soul before our creation / And after we were drops and in the cradle.
It increased as we increased and became growing / It is not, even if we die, breaking the covenant.
But it remains over every event / And visiting us in the darkness of the grave and the tomb.

He also said:

Greet Lubna today if you are going early / And visit her a visit of 'there is no meeting'.
Nights and months pass and I do not see / My fondness for her increasing except in persistence.
O Lord, gather my soul and her soul / By Your power, my tricks have wearied me.
I see myself, if I pray, turning towards her / With my face, even if the prayer place is behind me.
I have no polytheism, but her love / Is like the bone of choking, wearying the treating doctor.
So die, you, O my heart, if you are dying / For Lubna, otherwise be consoled if you are consoling.
My friend, I have worn out and I do not see / For Lubna regarding abandonment except as she is.
People have a concern, and she is my concern as long as I live / Among people, or my ecstasy if I am alone.
Between the entrails and the heart of mine is heat / And a whisper of sadness leaving the heart absentminded.
The eye has flows whenever I mention her / On the neck... whoever was weeping.
I love of names what agreed with her name / And resembled it or was close to it.
I desire sleep (fainting) while I have no fainting / Perhaps a phantom of yours meets a phantom of mine.
If the ears ring, I say: She mentioned me / Or my eye twitched, I hoped for meeting.
I see myself when I separated from Lubna as if / My right hand, I see I separated it from my left.
If they prevent her or distance stands before her / They will not prevent my heart from the mention alone.
Nor will they prevent my eye from tears whenever / A thought ran in the heart from her mention to me.
No namesake of hers was mentioned in my presence / Among people except my tear wet my cloak.
Nor did the star by which one is guided rise / Nor the morning, except it stirred her mention to me.
My two friends, I have been sleepless and you slept / At a Yemeni lightning, so sit and distract me.

He also said:
My soul is a ransom for him whom my heart remembers forever / And who is turning his heart away from me, patient.
And him whose love increases in newness with me / While my love with him is worn of covenant, turning.

He also said:
I desire sleep at other than its time / Perhaps a meeting happens in the sleep.
Dreams give me glad tidings that I see you / O would that the dreams of sleep were certainty.

He also said:
O resurrector of the dead, lead me to the one / By whom my soul drank sickness and drank again.
She was stingy until if I asked her / For the mote of the eye from the blowing dust, she would be stingy.
If she prevents, stinginess is a nature of hers / And if she gives, she gives little and obligates.

He also said:
May the pouring of cloud thunders water the face of Lubna / Where she touched and became of the earth.
In every case, whether she came near or went far / And if she comes near us, nearness is what we want.
Neither despair consoles me nor does nearness benefit me / And Lubna is refusing, she hardly gives.
Lubna shot me in the heart with her arrow / And the arrow of Lubayna is a hunter of the heart.
Ask every possessor of grief, I knew his place / And my heart is loving to Lubna as long as I live.
I treat from my soul remains of a spirit / On the last breath, while the visitors visit.
If Lubna is mentioned, I rejoice at her mention / Just as the fertile one rejoices at the flowing breast.

Abu Tammam Habib bin Aws Al-Tai said:
May God water the one I love despite the distance of his separation / And his turning away from me and length of his roughness.
God refused except that I be tasked with his love / So I became regarding him pleased with His decree.
I singled my eye out with tears so it became / And every eyelid of it choked with its water.
If I die of ecstasy for him and passion / How many a lover died before me of his disease.

He also said:
My phantom met him in slumber so he avoided / And I kissed his shadow one day so he got angry.
And he was informed that I passed by his door / To snatch a look at him, so he veiled himself.
If the East Wind passed by his ear / With my mention, he would curse the wind or blame.
No thought ran from me in his conscience / And appeared, except you were a cause in it.
His ugly deed did not increase him in my view / Nor the repulsion and turning away, except in endearment.

He also said:
The slanderers said: His cheek hair appeared on the cheek / I said: Do not do much, that is not his defect.
When he rose with buttocks pulling him / And his mustache became green above the pearls of teeth.
The rose swore solemn oaths / That its wonders would not separate from his cheeks.
I spoke to him with non-speaking eyelids / So part of his reply was what his eyebrow said.
His beauty is upon what I knew / And the hair is a protection for him from who seeks him.
The sweetest and best his traits were / When his cheek hair appeared and his shoulders turned green (strong).

He also said:
Leave me and drinking passion, O drinker of the cup / For I am sipping what I sipped.
Let not what you found ugly of my distress frighten you / For his place in me is the best of people.
From my solitude in him is the beginning of every calamity / And my thought in him is the beginning of every whisper.
From the cutting of his words is the connection of my destruction / And the connection of his glances is the cutting of my breaths.
I was gifted a tenderness of heart from him, disturbed / By a disturber from a watcher whose heart is hard.
When shall I live by hoping for hope if / The cutting of my hope is in the hand of my despair?

He also said:
A moon smiled revealing growing pearls / So I remained staring at him with the eye of the bewildered.
Every beauty ceased not to fall short of him / Until he exceeded the descriptions of the describer.
Beauty prostrated to his face when it saw / The amazement of minds at his exceeding beauty.
I hope to attain his connection / By sympathy from him and despite the nose of the gloater.

He also said:
He came to her with the perfume of her family, so she laughed / And said: Does the perfume seek and judge the perfume?
Her conversations are pearls and pearls are her speech / And I have not seen pearls before her stringing pearls.

He also said:
This is your passion and these are its traces / As for the heart, its decision does not settle.
He connects the groan with a connected sigh / With a burning of longing whose fire is not extinguished.
He called the tears, so they came pouring / Yearning, and that is its utmost and his utmost.
From an eye prevented of sleep, enslaved / Sleepless, his night and day are equal.

He also said:
Every day you are in a form / Other than the one you were in yesterday.
You increase in goodness every day just as / The branch of the Ban tree increases in the planting.

He also said:
Move your heart where you wish of passion / Love is only for the first lover.
How many a home on earth the youth becomes accustomed to / But his yearning is forever for the first home.

He also said:
Moderate one, his justice was not moderate / In a lover whose insanity with him was prolonged.
Is his glance better or his wit / Or his face better or his mind?
Look, for what you saw in others / Of beauty, it belongs to him entirely.
If it were said to beauty 'Wish a wish' / It would wish that it were like him.
What traits my master possessed / Had his procrastination not muddied their clarity.

He also said:
Your sleep, O my eye, is forbidden to you / So let go of tears whose flow is pouring.
For in the tear is extinguishing of the fire of passion / That has a blaze between the folds of the ribs.
O my hot liver which has cracked / From ecstasy, melt; there is no blame on you.
I fulfilled a covenant to passion that was obligatory / On me, and I also have a covenant on it.
O face to whom faces that are mighty / Were humiliated, and he attacked with might that cannot be sought.
Protect one seeking refuge in passion with you, spreading / His hands to you while eyes are sleeping.

He also said:
Peace be upon him who does not return my peace / And who does not see me as a place for his speech.
What is upon him if he answers a greeter / While my protection does not decree the greeting?

He also said:
Beauty is a part of your beautiful face / O moon overlooking a branch.
If you are unique in beauty, then I am / O unique of beauty, unique of sadness.
Every sickness you see in anyone / Is a branch, and the root is in my body.
The latencies of love before your existence in / The hearts of lovers did not exist.

He also said:
You were given of the joys of beauty the most splendid / And exceeded of the scents of perfume the most fragrant.
So beauty is discarded and perfume is exposed / And the Houris became, after God, your clients.

He also said:
An apple wounded by pearls from her mouth / Is more appetizing to me than the world and what is in it.
Red in yellowness, topped with Ghaliya (perfume) / As if it was picked from the cheek of its giver.
A songstress came with it from a rich beauty / My soul is a ransom for her from sickness and sorrows.
If I were dead and she called me with her melody / I would answer her for longing from my grave.

He also said:
He carried my life in his hands / O my sorrow and O my longing for him.
Exalted is God, O blessedness for an eye / That enjoys its look at his cheeks.

He also said:
I saw in sleep that reconciliation pushes him / Or that my master, after nearness, has distanced.
Why did I not die of sadness? Why did I not die of folly? / Why did I not die of panic? Why did I not die of grief?
I almost swore, except that this is excess / That I will not taste sleep after it ever.

I became, from sighs I cannot bear / Complaining of sleep when others complain of insomnia.

Abu Nuwas Al-Hasan bin Hani said:
May God water a deer showing coquetry in the enclosure / Swaying like the Ban branch from the thinness of the waist.
In his eyes is magic apparent in his eyelids / And in his scent is goodness like the fragrant perfume.
He is the full moon except that in him is saltiness (beauty) / With languor of glance that the sun and moon do not have.
He laughs revealing a salty mouth as if it is / Bubbles of wine or pure pearls.
Sweet are his front teeth and like wine is his saliva / And his cheek and the wine are in the delicacy of wine.
He shunned me without a crime I committed against him / And left me emaciated, empty of patience.
May God water days, when there was no abandonment between us / And the stick of youth shook in green leaves.
And watering for days that passed while fresh / O would that they returned and lasted to the Resurrection.
I went early to pleasures, tearing the veil / And the daughters of... led me to openness.
I saw the nights lying in wait / ... racing time.
I was content from the world with a cup and a fawn / ... intelligent of thought.
Healthy, sick of eyelid, nearing, distancing / He kills and revives with connection and abandonment.
As if the light of the sun... / ... between the collarbones and the waist.
Whenever... appeared / The image of the full moon rises from it.

He also said:
I say to her: You were stingy... / So be generous in sleep to a fond lover.
She said: No. And you became sleeping too? / And hoping that I visit you in sleep?

He also said:
O moon of the night when it darkened / Does the greeting decrease him who greets?
You were possessing connection, so who is he who / Taught you abandonment? No, he did not know.
If you are unjust to me among people / I am content that you remain and be unjust.

He also said:
And a girl having the form of beauties / Young of age in the dress of a boy.
I say to her when the drinking companions slept / Return my fond heart.
She said: Who? I said... / She said: When did you enter yourself into...?
I said to her: You overcame my heart / When you showed Dal and Lam (coquetry/hair).
She said to me: You slept? You saw good / I see you saw this in sleep.

He also said:
Jinan insults me, she mentioned / And claims that I am a flatterer, malicious.
And that my affection is a lie and falsehood / And that I am for whom I love, a breaker (of promises).
It is not so, nor a rejection to her / But the bored one is the breaker.
I have a heart struggling towards her / And a longing between my ribs, urging.
She saw my fondness for her and the permanence of my ecstasy / So she got bored of me; thus was the hadith.

He also said:
A tender, soft, heavy-hipped girl / My heart wandered with her love.
Her figure is the best figure / Ask who saw her.
God did not create her except / As a temptation when He created her.
She scatters pearls when she sings / Upon us, her lips.
You see pride for the Oud / When her hands hold it.
She is my worry and my wish / I wish I were her wish.

He also said:
News came to me of an insult from you to me, so my insult / Is it not that my name ran in your mouth? Then feel (or enough).
So say what appears to you to say / For what is it all but for my imprisonment.

He also said:
It is hard on me that you find like my ecstasy / Because love, the easiest of it is severe.
I saw love as fires blazing / Hearts of lovers are fuel for them.
I wish if they burned, they would perish / But whenever they burn, they return.
Like the people of Fire; if skins are cooked / Skins are returned to them for misery.

He also said:
What is with me and people? How much they blame me foolishly / My religion is for myself and the religion of people is for people.
God knows that my leaving your visit / Is only for fear of my enemies and guards.
If I were able to come, I would come to you / Dragging on the face, not walking on the head.

He also said:
My ransom for you! I have no turning away from you / Nor do I have justice from you in love.
Your connection to me is the purified honey / And your abandonment to me is the instant poison.
I circumambulate your palace every day / As if the circumambulation was created for your palace.
Were it not for your love, I would have stuck to my house / For in my house I have the flowing wine.

He also said:
O he for whom speech is not desired / How then, other than speech, is desired?
Nor greeting except from afar / So the peace includes me with the people.
I love blame regarding her only / To hear them mention her name in what I am blamed for.

And her love enters every heart / Entrances that wine does not penetrate.

He also said:
When I saw the ships descending / Distancing my loved ones from my sight.
I stood weeping on their shores / So the increase of water is from my tears.

He also said:
Indeed, he whom I love was stingy with his affection / And followed that with his repulsion.
O sorrow after affection! He is / Stingy to me with greeting and returning it.
His goodness and beauty called me to him / And magic in his eyes and a mole on his cheek.
I have not seen like me becoming a slave to like him / Nor like him a master harming his slave.

He also said:
O he whom his creator refined so He formed him / A dune of sand in a branch of the Ban tree.
His glance did not connect with the eyes of people / Except all secrets and public matters became equal.

He also said:
O he who broke covenants and got bored of me / I knew that this would be.

For him:
And one loved of traits and coquetry / Like the horn of the sun in the body of a gazelle.
He wrapped himself in saltiness (beauty) and wore it / And clothed himself in beauty and perfection.
The peak of a sun branched in a rod / And a sand dune shook in straightness.
He has a beautiful mole on his cheek / My soul is a ransom for that, from a cheek and a mole.

He also said:
Pour me wine and tell me it is wine / And do not give me to drink in secret when openness is possible.
For loss is only that you see me sober / And gain is only that drunkenness makes me stumble.
So reveal the name of whom you love and leave nicknames / There is no good in pleasures which have a curtain before them.

He also said:
And one extending over the reddish wine, he came early to it / Among youths skilled in the morning drink of wine.
Everything he saw, he thought it a cup / And every person he saw, he said: This is my cupbearer.

He also said:
And a cup like the lamp of the sky I drank / At a kiss or an appointment of meeting.
The days came before it until as if it / Is falling light from the tears of the sky.
You see its light from the outside of the cup shining / Upon you, even if you covered it with a cover.

He also said:
Leave blaming me, for blame is incitement / And cure me with that which was the disease.
Yellow, sorrows do not settle in its courtyard / If a stone touched it, joy would touch it.
It thinned from water until it does not suit it / In delicacy, and water became rough for its form.

He also said:
Drink pure wine like the rooster's eye, clear / From the hand of a cupbearer like the gazelle, wide-eyed.
Red, not leaving a yellow one, if mixed / Rising with two lucks of beauty and shine.

He also said:
Serve your brother wine / For life is the addiction to wine.
Even if the blamers blame, I am not one / Who avoids pleasure for fear of the Imam.
Forbidden, its beginning was lawful / So let the lawful go with the forbidden.

He also said:
The shine of morning appeared / So drive away worry with wine.
Fie on a leaver of pleasures / Of drinking companions for righteousness.
Say to him who seeks my righteousness / I sold my guidance for error.
The palm of a witty one won / Who sold piety for a sin.
The best of pleasures is what / Was open with exposure.

He also said:
Wine is an apple that ran melted / Likewise the apple is wine that froze.
So drink, upon its solid, its melt / And do not leave the enjoyment of a day for tomorrow.

He also said:
She stood showing me, while the command of night was gathered / A morning generated between water and grapes.
As if the small and large of its bubbles / Were pebbles of pearls on a ground of gold.

He also said:
O suitor of the reddish-brown coffee, giving dowry for it / With the pound, taking its weight in gold.
You fell short with the wine, so beware hearing it / Or the vine might swear not to bear grapes.
I gave for it, when I was fond of it / For the Sa' (measure), a Sa' of rubies that were not bored.

He also said:
As if it, with the pure water when mixed / Is a net of pearls on a brocade of ruby.
A moon circulates it, in his glance is intense whiteness/blackness / As if the magic of Harut was derived from it.

He also said:
Console yourself with wine from what its demand missed / Even if the blaming scolder blamed for it.
Red, clear, in the color of a jewel / In the scent of amber, in the taste of an apple.
From the hand of one with coquetry whose beauties grew / Like the full moon, with a nasal sound, swaying, joking.
As if... / A moon walks with it carrying a lamp.
My error is upon me, so leave me from a possessor / If it is error, then I have my error and my righteousness.

He also said:

Do not pay attention to the saying of the blaming scolder / And drink at the arrival (of drinkers) from the chilled wine.
Reddish-brown, clear, its flavor gives you / The breath of musk smeared with apples.
Until when it chains in the bottom of a jar / Its shine enriches you from the light of a lamp.
It gifted... / And wine is the most similar thing guiding to wine.

He also said:
I ceased not taking the spirit of the jar with kindness / And drawing its blood from the hollow of a wounded one.
Until I became intoxicated, and I have two spirits in my body / And the jar is thrown, a body without a spirit.

He also said:
Do not weep for Layla and do not yearn for Hind / And drink at the arrival from a red one like the rose.
A cup, when it descends in the throat of its drinker / You find its redness in the eye and the cheek.
For wine is a ruby, and the cup is a pearl / In the hand of a pearl, slender of figure.
She gives you drink from her hand wine, and from her mouth / Wine, so you have two intoxications inevitably.
I have two intoxications, and the companion has one / A thing I was singled out with among them alone.

He also said:
Do not stay at a drawing or ruin / And seek wine like the rooster's eye, my drinking companion.
Pure wine of a jar, when water mixes with it / Diffuses scent as an apple in Lebanon diffuses.
Like musk if broached, and alloy if poured / Resembling, if mixed, a crown of coral.
